reviews.text: This resort is part of two hotels and we stayed at the Colonial and would recommend this to any traveler. We upgraded our room to a swim up room which was certainly worth it. From the time of checking in, Ana and staff were very professional. The grounds were gorgeous and all staff always accommodating. The beach is beautiful with entertainment options. Bala bala greeted us ever morning offering water sports and fun activities. The hotel amongst the strip is located in a perfect place so you can walk from end to end. Night swimming was great! Water was warm. Best mother and daughter vacation so far and can't wait till the next!!!
reviews.title: Amazing honeymoon

reviews.text: Well hello vacationers,
reviews.title: A Long Review!

reviews.text: My family members are Dominican natives, so every summer we go and vacation there and stay at new resorts. The Majestic has by far been the best pick. In total, there were 63 of us staying at the majestic and considering the large number of us staying there, check in was VERY fast. It will usually take about an hour at the least for us to be checked in and this time it took only about 20 minutes. Upon arrival they greet you with a cold towel and a cold colata which is great for the tropical weather. I would assume that since it only took 20 minutes to check in 63 people it would take even less time to check in a smaller group.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: FOOD
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

likes.liked: — The staff, especially Hilario, Carlix, and Kayla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before going on the trip I religiously came to trip advisor to catch up on new reviews. I became worried about the food and I find that although it wasn't gourmet food, it was fine. The food was pretty basic. You can always find something to eat at the supreme buffet. Don't eat the pancakes at breakfast, they were awful, but the waffles are great! For lunch and dinner they have a lot of varieties so you will find something, believe me! You can also try one of the restaurants although we had a terrible experience at La Hispaniola restaurant: the service was horrible! They didn't take our orders til about 25 minutes after we sat and the food didn't come til about 40 mins after we ordered (and only 5 of us were at my table, everyone else was eating somewhere else or had already eaten). And it wasn't even out waiter who brought us our food! We had to ask another man to find out where our food was. After that night I decided to stick to the buffet, where I know how long it will take to get my food!
reviews.title: Truly Majestic!

likes.liked: — The room, pool, variety of restaurants

reviews.text: SERVICE
reviews.title: Loved the Majestic

likes.disliked: — Husband didn't like that the pool closed at 6:30 pm

reviews.text: As I just said, the service at La Hispaniola restaurant was terrible, but since I didn't try any other restaurants I can't speak for them. Service at the door of the buffet can also be a bit unrefined during lunch hour. Since during those hours (12 noon- 3pm) people are either on the beach on in the pool, when they want to go to lunch they are wet. The people at the door do not tolerate that and will make you go back to your rooms and change (try to get a room not ending in a number after 25 if you want to be close to the buffet). Service everywhere else was pretty ordinary. Nothing to brag about. HOWEVER! There are some men by the beach who claim to take you in a boat ride to see dolphins, to a natural pool, and scuba diving. DO NOT DO IT. The dolphins we saw were part of another resort and were putting on a show about 80 feet away for people who paid for it. Standing so far trying to see was embarrassing! The natural pool was nice, it was at the beach and about 4 feet deep away from the shore so it was nice. NOT worth the 2 HOUR trip on a very small boat though. And about the scuba diving, YEAH right. If you want to do real scuba diving speak to someone who comes to the pool everyday to give scuba lessons. They had a bucket full of goggles and used mouth pieces covered in sand and salt water. It was gross.THE WORST PART OF ALL was when we ran out of gas about 40 minutes away from the resort. The man had to swim to shore to buy gasoline. We were very upset!!! There were 25 of us in two boats and some of the people on one boat were paying for some people on the other boat and vice versa. The two men driving the boats pretended like no one paid so we ended up paying double for the boat ride from hell!! DON'T DO IT! Stick to ALL resort activities and make SURE they WORK for the resort! That was the mistake we made; believing they had a partnership with the resort. Stick to things in the resort and you will have a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Paradise

Although the pastries were amazying: eggs, cereals, and juices were good, everything else was bad. My honey got sick the first day and i bet it's from the "suprime" food. At times it seemed like bad cafeteria food, smells, and looks of it. But Bread and Butter, wow!!!

We mostly ate our lunch in the place at the beach, and dinner was great at Japanese, La Gourmet, two places on the beach(sea food and steak). It's sad but they don't really have great meat sauce nor salad dressings. And during lunch they don't really know how to cook meats...

reviews.text: What an amazing adventure we had at the Majestic! We were 4 women celebrating our 40th birthdays. We were told that special accomodations would be made for us since we were originally booked at the Elegance, which is not open yet. We were a little nervous when they explained that all 4 of us were going to have to share a room--boy, were we pleased with the set-up when we saw it! It was a huge suite and they brought in twin beds and there was plenty of room for all of us. The room was gorgeous and huge! Sharing a bathroom was never an issue for us. The details attended to by the staff made everything very special. We were greeted with Jack-o-lantern apples on the coffee table (Nov.2, when we checked in was their big Halloween shin-dig) and beautiful towel animals, flowers and bubbles in the tub--wow!
reviews.title: Queens at the Majestic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is what you think of when you think of the Carribean! White, powdery sand, crystal blue water, palm trees, and sun! There was only one vendor that we saw the whole time and he only approached if you asked him to. There were waves, but still very relaxing to get just past where they break on land and bob around in the ocean. There was only one day with seaweed in the water and it was after a day of rain. We mostly stayed on the beach due to the music--we'd rather hear the waves! But, people sure looked like they were having fun by the pool!
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday

likes.disliked: — The food in a couple of the restaurants

reviews.text: The food we had was excellent and none of us ever had a problem. Our favorite restaurant was the French place, Le Gourmet. Incredible food there. Make reservations when you check in. We had to wait until our last night to eat at the japanese place and we reserved 6 days in advance. The Japanese was good food, but our cook was very dull. He didn't do any of the fun stuff that you expect at that kind of restaurant. The Steak and Seafood places were both good--we preferred the steak and ate there twice. The Mexican place was just OK.--no salsa! What's that about?!?!
reviews.title: The best all inclusive I have ever been to!!

reviews.text: You must get your picture taken by their photographers. It is reasonable cost and great pics. We had Santiago take ours and he did an incredible job!
reviews.title: Tom - Marlton NJ

reviews.text: We left the resort four times. We had Mario with Turinter book our excursions and every one of them was an incredible experience--would highly recommend seeing some of the island and meeting the wonderful people there. Ziplining was great, especially stopping at the little farm on the way and meeting a sweet family. We loved swimming with the dolphins at Dolphin Island. And we celebrated birthdays dancing at Imagine--cool cave and very nice people. Our fourth outing did leave much to be desired. We walked to the nearby vendors. We wished we hadn't--they were very pushy and it became exhausting rather than fun.

reviews.text: All I can say is that this hotel/resort exceeded my expectations! I traveled with a group of 14 people hailing from Texas, Maryland , and Illinois for a dual birthday celebration with ages averaging from late 20’s to late 30’s. We traveled on the dates May 29 through June 2, 2008. I can say that I had my doubts about the Majestic prior to coming to the resort. Many of the reviews from other travelers made me want to ask for my deposit back. Please do not believe these people!!! I’m going to go quickly down the list of events to give you honest unbiased feedback.
reviews.title: Great Trip...Don't believe the reviews!!!!

reviews.text: Hotel/room: The room looks just like the pictures. Yes, there is an open concept but just bring a robe if you're not rooming with a mate. The only time there is a problem is if you decide you want to take a bath; my roommate did while I was elsewhere. No big deal. Some people mentioned the slight musty smell….yes that can be a problem when your hotel is 5 feet away from the ocean with outdoor rooms!!! Get over it, once you take a shower the smell goes away.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel but would not go back

likes.disliked: — FOOD LEFT A LOT TO BE DESIRED. THE PASTRY CHEF SHOULD BRUSH UP ON HIS BAKING SKILLS

reviews.text: I will say that a guest on our trip “lost” her watch. I read that this might happen. I told all the people in my group prior to coming not to bring anything valuable to the resort. Some people used the safe. However, I also read that safes were being broken into. The smartest thing I saw someone do was to bring a solid lock for her suitcase. If someone wants your items that bad to steal your entire suitcase- maybe they need it more than you?! All and all the rooms were nice, great room service, and the refrigerator was stocked everyday.

If not, the beach buffet was also tasty. We tried all of the restaurants and the food did not disappoint us. Will you have a steak that tastes like it’s from Morton’s? No, but you should enjoy the food as if you were going to any other restaurant. And if you don’t like what you ordered….get something else…It’s all-inclusive remember????????
Beach/pool: Great no problems! Plenty of room and the drinks were always on time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I were at the Majestic Colonial from March 7-15, our first trip to Punta Cana. I had read Trip Advisor reviews for months before we left so knew the pro's and con's, but we were surprised at the number of children at the resort, from newborns to 18-year-old's. While there, we learned it was school break for Canada. There were a few groups of spring breakers, also a bit surprising, but they seemed well-behaved with no typical spring break rowdiness that we could see. We had a great room, a Majestic Colonial suite (not swim-up) which was a corner room on the fourth floor. it overlooked another resort, but it was very quiet which I'd take any day over a room with a nice view with constant noise. It was clean, didn't smell musty, and everything seemed to work in it. I didn't think the bed was uncomfortable, which a lot of reviews mentioned - maybe the king beds have a better mattress.
reviews.title: Very pretty resort with a friendly hardworking staff

reviews.text: Although we traveled as a couple without children, we chose the Colonial and not the Elegance, which supposedly has less children, because reviews mentioned the beach was bigger at the Colonial. The beach was gorgeous, although quite crowded most days as was the pool. We did see a few beach chair altercations between guests - I know this happens at most resorts everywhere, but it's too bad there isn't a better system of reserving a chair at the beach or pool. Guests thought by just folding down the top of their beach chair (not even putting a towel there) that it would guarantee that chair would be theirs for the entire day. The best Trip Advisor tip I got was to bring cheap beach towels from home - my husband went down most mornings between 6:30 and 7:30 a.m., would put our beach towels on either a pool chair or beach chair - after breakfast we would return to the chairs which were always undisturbed. The resort gives you one towel card per person when you check in which you exchange for a towel each day. If you don't have a card or towel to return at the end of the day, you can't get another towel, and I think they charge $25 for a lost towel.
reviews.title: Nice resort: The good and the bad

reviews.text: The weather was beautiful, low to mid 80's every day, but very windy the whole time which created rough surf most of the time. Because of this we only went swimming in the ocean one day.

reviews.text: Because of the occasional language barrier, it was sometimes hard to get some bartenders to understand which drink you wanted (even something simple as vodka and tonic). One thing at the lobby bar we found annoying was that when we went to get a drink there before dinner, we sometimes had to stand up because some of the guests' small children were sitting on barstools next to their parents at the bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at the resort, to our last day, what stuck out the most was the service we received at Majestic Colonial. Upon arrival we were greeted with the famous "Majestic" drink and were helped to our rooms. We enjoyed interacting with the staff at Majestic, particularly the Animation Team that ran the afternoon activities. A few people I would like acknowledge was a man named Denny, who brought us drinks right on the beach and was so friendly and willing to give us whatever we needed. He was wonderful to visit with, and was very good at his job. Another person that made our honeymoon special was the hostess at the main buffet hall every morning. She was also the hostess at the Le Gourmet restaurant we frequented. She remembered us each morning, the languages we spoke, and was so warm and friendly.
reviews.title: great honeymoon!

reviews.text: The beach was amazing, the food was great, the resort itself was spectacular...we never left.
reviews.title: Loved the Majestic

reviews.text: I would recommend this resort to anyone looking to get away to the Caribbean for a holiday.
reviews.title: Love to go back for my next vacation

reviews.text: As a travel agent myself, I won this trip to the Majestic Colonial. It was one of the best vacations I have been on. First of all the hotel itself is spotless and beautiful. As for the staff, the nicest people I have ever met that worked in a hotel - from the moment we arrived all of them couldn't be friendlier. The Animation Team was amazing. They were always on the go - playing games by the pool or the beach to putting on a nightly show (which all of the shows were fantastic) to dancing at the Disco. They always made you feel special. The two members of the team that stand out for me were John (Aerobics instructor) - very energetic and a pleasure to be around. The other is my favorite - Jesus (Supervisor of the Animation Team) - he sat and talked to you whether at the pool or the disco. He has an excellent personality and a lot of fun to be around. The entire staff was wonderful. I would recommend this hotel in a minute (as I have already done since I have returned 2 days ago). I will personally be returning to this hotel (with a bunch of my friends) to show them what a good time I had.
reviews.title: Majestic is a fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: This was our 2nd time to Punta Cana, and our 1st stay at the Majestic. It was tough not to compare to our previous resort stay at the Grand Palladium Bavaro four years ago! The first thing we noticed was the tremendous amount of construction going on as we entered the hotel grounds. We were a bit disappointed at the landscaping, as this could not compare to the beautiful grounds of the Grand Palladium. Keep in mind, the construction.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

likes.liked: — Beafutiful rooms, cleanliness, beach, pool, staff
likes.disliked: — Not enough food choices for younger children during dinner

reviews.text: Once we entered the lobby, check in was quick, easy, and we were greeted with a "Majestic" non-alcoholic drink, which is just want we needed after our long trip. While we were not escorted to our room as our other travel companions had been, getting around and finding our room was quite easy. Compared to the Grand Palladium, the Majestic is on much smaller grounds, although still quite large. We had two adjoining rooms with 7 in our party. The rooms were quite amazing! Every room is a suite, and they are top notch. I have read a lot of reviews about the bathrooms being open. While this is true for the tub and sink area, the toilet and shower stalls have coated-glass doors, and there is privacy. Each room has a balcony with table and chairs, and we had a beautiful view of the pool area and an ocean "view" (rooms 3332 and 3333). We did have a problem the first two days with the room "sensor" system. This system indicates when you are in or out of your room, and it also shuts off the fan and air conditioning system while you are out. The problem with ours was that it constantly thought we were out and kept shutting off. After contacting the front desk several times and finally getting the manager of the hotel and the manager of maintenance, they were able to override the system, and the problem was fixed. We were told that this is a known problem with a few rooms in the hotel... so just beware. We also had several power outages nightly, which the staff blamed on "financial issues" in the country, whatever that means.
reviews.title: A good time was had by all..

reviews.text: As for the food, I think it was pretty average. We had some really good meals, and we had some really average meals. I do think they could have catered more towards little children (we traveled with a 6 year old). The food at the Grand Palladium was excellent, and although the food at Majestic was good too, I think GP was just a bit better. We ate at the Hibachi, which was probably one of the best meals, although our chef was new and didn't give us quite the show we expected. The steak house restuarant was quite good, although there was nothing on the menu for children. We asked for a hot dog, which we know they serve at lunch, but we were told they could not provide us with one, so our son had a roll for dinner, which was the case most evenings in every restaurant, even the buffet. We finally wised up by the middle of the week and took about 3 hot dogs at lunch and wrapped them up for dinner, so at least our son had something to eat. We were disappointed that the sports bar, which served hamburgers, nachos, buffalo wings, etc. was only opened at 11:00 pm, at which time our 6 yo was already sleeping. I guess again, in comparison to the Grand Palladium, they had a 24-hour sports bar that had everything from hot dogs, hamburgers, pizza, popcorn, nachos, ice cream, etc. I guess I was expecting the same 24 hour service. Other than that, none of us went home starving or losing any weight!
reviews.title: Loved the Majestic Colonial Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drinks were plentiful. Each day we tried to find a new "special of the day" drink. The Majestics with rum were great... as were the dirty bananas, banama mamas, and the blue lagoons. We found that the best drinks were in the hotel lobby (nice and frozen).
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.text: The pool and beach were excellent. I must say that even though the hotel was booked, you would never know by looking at the pool/beach. We never had a problem finding a chair, or group of chairs (14 of us all together), and we did not hit the pool/beach until at least 11:00 am. There were plenty of activities at both each day, and we all took advantage of everything we could, even the 6 yo. They do have a Kids Club, but the activities there were not too appealing to him, as there were more fun things to do at the beach or pool.
reviews.title: Fabulous! Perfect family vacation!

likes.liked: — Location, beach, staff, fabulous layout of the entire resort, room size.
likes.disliked: — Firm mattress took some getting used to, needed extra pillows because the pillows are not plump

reviews.text: We found the resort to be everything we wanted in an all inclusive resort. The staff were friendly and helpful. The beach and pool were beautiful. The resort was clean and many options for food. Options to stay as busy or relaxed as you want.
reviews.title: Wonderful going back

reviews.text: Stayed in the Colonial Club from March 2nd through March 9th, and it was by far the best time I've had anywhere. Ever. The service is incredible, the entire staff was pleasant and seemed thrilled to be there helping us. The resort itself is absolutely gorgeous, from the palm-strewn walkways to the vibrant, colorful landscapes of flowers, shrubs and trees, to the Majestic beach itself. Anything one could have asked for was there, waiting for you to take it. Bed on the beach? Check. Rather hang out with great bartenders, bellied up to a pool bar? Check. A smile on every workers face? Check. Delightful scattering of establishments so one never goes thirsty or hungry? Double check. Food, music, ocean, laughter and drinks; the best possible recipe for any vacation. Our group was given a private concierge, Francisco, who was fantastic, friendly, and very knowledgeable. If the pool bar is your gig (it sure was ours) I recommend the staff at the Colonial pool closest to the beach; the biggest of shout-outs to Arelis, Nolberto, Silvestre and Yasmis for keeping our cups full and our towels dry! "Blondie" is coming back you guys, see you next year!
reviews.title: Best Vacation of my life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have spend a fantastic week at the Majestic Colonial Club, and we would recommend it to anyone. The suite was huge and the bed so comfy. We like the walk in shower as well nice and roomy. The resort is well kept inside and out, the staff is very friendly and helpful, there is a choice of food for everybody. Breakfast was a good start of the day, our special table was always ready for us. Lunch always at the Rodeo Grill, thanks Leonardo, the manager, for our special toasted sandwiches, Wrkia, the hostess, was so welcoming and always made sure we were looked after, then there were Oney, Carlos, Nicolas,Roman, Antonio and Astacio, making sure our glasses were filled and plates were cleaned away to make room for the next course. The Rodeo Grill also is great for dining, may it be meat or fish. Service was friendly and fast. And our compliments to the Club swim up bar staff, Jose, Carlos and Ana Carina, did a great job entertaining us, while they were busy serving all the guests their drinks. Entertainment at night was always great every day something different. We will certainly return next year. Special thanks to Angel Holgado for arranging a late check-out, so that we could enjoy our last day. Alfred and Maria K., Mississauga, Canada
reviews.title: Third visit to The Majestic, first time Colonial Club.

reviews.text: My friend and I went to the Majestic with our husbands for our 28th and 30th birthdays in December. The resort is HUGE compared to what I have been to. The grounds are EXTREMELY well-maintained, and the staff is all very, very nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property - Pack the Pepto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in took a little longer than expected, and we were not able to upgrade to the adult only section as we had hoped...but in my mind I didn't care because the longer it took to check in the more sweets I could eat off of the cart that was being pushed around :)
reviews.title: 2 Weeks is not long enough!

reviews.text: My sister and I spent one of the best 7days of our lives living like princesses at the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana. The people were friendly and helpful. My cheeks hurt from smiling everyday. There was something new to do everyday. We loved our favorite bartender Angel. He is so sweet and friendly and down to earth and soooo appreciative. We love the hotel! It looks exactly like the pictures. We can't believe how beautiful it was when we walked in. Flowers lined our bathtub and a bottle of sparkling wine was waiting on the table. It was like a dream. Absolutely fabulous! I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: We <3 U Angel @ the Majestic

He assured us that all produce etc. was washed in purified water and water at eating areas was also purified. Take your chances on that.

reviews.text: My Fiance and I stayed at the Majestic from 29th Sept - 14th Oct. When we got to the hotel we were very impressed, the lobby is beautiful, the reception staff and porters are very good and you get a Majestic cocktail (non-alcoholic) on arrival.

reviews.text: The hotel has a very grand staircase that leads down to the resort.

reviews.text: The resort itself is very beautful. The gardens are extremely well kept with a huge variety of plants. The are water fountains around the lobby which look good in the sun. The pool is the most amazing pool I've ever seen. It goes all the way down from the top of the resort to the beach front and has jacuzzis at each end and a pool bar in the middle. The only thing I'd say about the pool is you can't lay in the sun quietly very easily. At around lunch time they put the speakers on at the bar in the middle and turn it up really loud so you can't really get away from it. The annoying thing about this is they only have about 3 CD's they play during the day so the songs get very old very quickly. Unfortunatelty they also do this on the beach so this was one of my bad points about the resort.
reviews.title: Sub-4 Star

reviews.text: I have been meaning to write this review for months. My husband & I spent a week at the Majestic last October for our 1-year anniversary. It was an absolutely amazing vacation and I would recommend the Majestic to anyone looking for a fun, relaxing and tropical vacation.
reviews.title: Loved the Majestic

likes.liked: — Stunning scenery & location, sunny days, relaxation, very fast & easy trip from East Coast of the US

reviews.title: Absolutely would go back.....
reviews.text: When we traveled last fall the Majestic was ranked #1 on Trip Advisor with very few negative reviews (it seems that has since changed slightly... which I'm sorry to hear). We had very high expectations after reading all of the great TA reviews and even some negative ones. In our experience the Majestic lived up to every great review and then some. The food was very good, resort and grounds are stunning and the beach, pool and lobby are more beautiful than any photo can show.

reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation
reviews.text: We had a standard room on the second floor overlooking the pool, steakhouse/seafood restaurant and a sliver of beach. While some people complain about how far it was to walk to the lobby, etc, it was NOT a big deal at all. We were very happy with the room. The shower was luxurious and although it was a little unusual to have the whirlpool tub out in the open next to the bed it was also very nice. Our philosophy on a trip like this is that - while it's nice to have a giant, top-of-the line room - it's not worth the extra expense because you spend most of your time at the beach/pool anyway. Even the least expensive rooms at a hotel like the Majestic are still very nice. And if you are lucky you will get upgraded at check in.

We really enjoyed the food at the Majestic and probably ate way too much of it (but then, what is vacation for if not to indulge?!) Banana milkshakes were my favorite part about breakfast. In our experience the food was always very good - and there are more than enough breakfast options for any fussy eater out there.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: For lunch the first day we ate at the restaurant by the beach but then for the rest of the time we went to lunch at the inside buffet (same room as breakfast). The inside lunch is worth the walk from the beach and much better when it comes to selection and quality. You cannot go in there if you are very wet from the pool or the beach. (While it makes complete sense that they don't want their soft chairs or tiled floors soaking wet, some people still complained about it.)
reviews.title: Nice place...but please read

reviews.text: We stayed there from Aug 17 to 24th.

reviews.title: Okay, but staff was very unhelpful

reviews.title: Time of our life

reviews.text: I stayed at the Majestic Colonial for 6 days, 5 nights, and was very happy with my stay. I LOVE the pool! It is beautiful! The entertainment at the pool was also great, but if you didnt want to be a part of it, the pool is large enough to distance yourself from it. I went to the gym which has enough equipment to get a full body workout in. There are free weights, tredmills, elipticals, a stair master, and bikes. There is also other various machines and benches. The guy in the gym, Cesar, was very helpful with the equipment and converting the kilograms to pounds. He also keeps some upbeat music playing, which is nice. And towels are provided in the gymk as well. It was very nice to have so many bi-lingual (and multi-lingual) workers.
reviews.title: Love the pool!!!!

reviews.text: Make sure you go to the theatre in the evening. The shows are excellent!

reviews.text: The only things I was not impressed with was the alcohol and food. I drank non-alcoholic beverages because the alcohol was not very good. If you like sweet, stick to the Majestic and Coco Loco. The food was not the best. All the seafood tasted the same, a lot of fried food, and meat in so many dishes, including seafood dishes. I recommend the French and Japanese restaurants, which are the only 2 you need a reservation for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and i had never been out of the united states and we also had never traveled together. for us this trip was a lot of first of us. we loved it! when we were booking we found the magestic in a travel maginzine, everyone we asked never heard of it, so we decided to try it. we are not picky travelers and simple things make us happy. getting off the bus from the airport they greeted us with cold towels and drinks. check in was a breeze. they carried our bags and showed us to our room. the room was nice and clean. we had a veiw of the pool. food was great, the buffets had something for everyone. plus a lot of comfort food from home. the staff was great very friendly. the beach went on forever, the water was a little rough, and its windy all the time, but the wind helps with heat. the pool is large, we walked in it from one end to the other its a good way to cheak out the whole resort. we got massages at the spa witch felt so good after our long flight from maine. now with a new section of resort opening up we are thinking of going back. we have lots to comment on so feel free to ask....

We snuck in for a week between Hurricane Ike and the rains in mid September. Except for one brief shower and a few clouds, every day was sunny and hot. I had e-mailed Richard in advanced and requested that us and the couple we traveled with were right next to each other and our request was granted. We stayed in room 3134 and it was absolutely amazing.

reviews.text: We didn't do any excursions. We enjoyed how our days were set up though. We did the beach all morning until we wanted to do lunch around 1ish and then enjoyed the rest of the day in the pool (which the pool is aboslutely amazing and you will never want to get out). The excursions seemed interesting, however we didn't want to be commited to something for the whole day off the resort. I would also recommend getting up early a few days and go for walks on the beach. It's aboslutely beautiful in the morning and it's such a nice walk!

We tried every place for dinner excecpt the seafood (us girls don't like seafood) and we enjoyed everything. I personally enjoyed Le Gourmet and the Steakhouse the best! Also, breakfast everyday was amazing!

reviews.text: The last topic I wanted to touch upon was the serice. I want to thank Richard again for all of his help before we arrived. I also want to give a huge THANKS to Denny. Denny works on the beach and made sure we were given plenty of drinks everyday. He is an amazing asset to the resort.

reviews.text: My husband and I just got home yesterday from the M.C. we went down for a wedding,We fell in love with this resort.The restaurants were all very good.My favorite was the gourmet,out of all the eaterys you only have to reserve this one and the Matsuri. The beach was beautiful ,as are the people.We`ve traveled alot over the past ten years and I`d have to say this resort will go to the top of our list as one of the finest.The rooms are large and well maintained.We had champaine in the room w/a couple of glasses to greet us, we added some bubbles to the tub ...I`ll tell you what, it was the beginning of a beautiful vacation .It was sunny everyday so we spent the majority of our trip on the baech. They have beach consierges that waist no time in serving up what ever you would like to drink.The consiege that looked after us was named Denny,he was a pleasure to talk to,he spoke very good english and was very knowledgeable about the area.we look forward to our next trip and who knows maybe we`ll land in the D.R next year thank you to the staff of M.C. for such great service we came home feeling veryrelaxed, pampared and ready to get back to work.To all of you positive travelers out there you`ll find the pro`s out way the cons 100 to 1! ....Enjoy.
reviews.title: the best beach consierges ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our second trip to the Majestic (2/13-2/18). I was a little concerned because the recent reviews weren't very favorable but once again the Majestic didn't let us down. Upon check in we asked for a room upgrade since we were returning customers and got a great pool side room on the first floor by the beach with a jacuzzi and 2 lounge chairs and a cafe set. Yes there is construction of their new hotel and we requested to be far away as they start early in the morning. We were greeted by Benito a member of the guest services staff. He escorted us to our room to make sure it was to our liking. At that time we told him what dinner reservations we wanted for the Japanese Steak house and the Gourmet restaurant. Within 15 minutes he called us and gave us our reservations and that he would leave them under our door. We enjoyed our complimentary Majestic breakfast outside on our patio which included lots of fresh fruit and freshly made breakfast rolls and muffins along with coffee, champagne and orange juice! Several afternoons we received a plate of fruit and a bottle of wine or sushi with wine. On valentine's day I got a rose and my husband a red t-shirt and a bottle of sparkling rose. The hotel is still spotless both inside and out. Yes at one time the ladies room was out of soap but that can happen anywhere. They are always keeping up with maintainence and it shows. The ancilliary staff don't go out of their way to say hello but if you habla en espanol un pequito they are quite surprised and pleased. The staff that come in contact with the guests always greet you and are very pleasant. Now if you you never want your glass empty speak to Ishmael or Yaser at the pool bar. They were making me stoli mojitos with equal instead of sugar....now that's service! The pool was spotless and clear. Plenty of beach chairs poolside and by the beach. Yes if you want a certain chair and a table you need to "reserve" it but we never had any trouble. I hope that the beach doesn't become to crowded after the addition of the new hotel. The sand is beautiful and the ocean color magnificant. I think they may have even dredged the beach because we both remember some rocks last year where the waves break but never encountered them. The other restaurants that don't require reservations are fine. We ate a lot of lobster, shrimp and beef. I think the lunch is better in the main hotel as opposed to by the beach. There is a bigger selection and more healthy items plus the thin crust pizza is delicious. My husband played golf twice and I used the Spa. The massage was better last year but maybe it was the masseuse. I would definitely still recommend this hotel and we probably will go back next year and maybe stay at the new one if it is complete!
reviews.title: Second time to the Majestic Colonial and still very pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I and another couple stayed at the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana from February 2 thru February 16. We enjoyed 2 wonderful weeks of relaxation, delightful entertainment and good food. We read many reviews on Trip Advisor prior to selecting the Majestic for our two week stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful Majestic Colonial

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean, the pool was wonderful, and the grounds were immaculate. Every day we saw several workers making sure the entire resort was presentable. Most every day, the groundskeepers picked up leaves from our yard (even if they saw just one leaf). There was also quite a bit of security around the facility. One evening my husband and I took a walk near the beach and found 4 security personnel watching the beach area. We felt very safe everywhere at this resort.
reviews.title: Beautiful Pool! Food hmmmm.

likes.liked: — Beautiful, spacious pool! Amazing. The best pool I have ever seen.
likes.disliked: — Food! The breakfast buffet was great. The rest just average.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the staff, with the exception of our maid spoke English. As with most countries, some people spoke better English than others. What I found amazing is that a good number of the staff spoke quite a bit of French and English. During our stay there was a large population of Canadians at the resort who spoke French. Most announcements were made in Spanish, English and French (and sometimes German).
reviews.title: Maybe not “Majestic” but not as horrible as we feared it would be...

reviews.text: Everyone we encountered at the resort was pleasant and very friendly. No matter who we passed in the halls, on the beach, or wherever we went they all said “hola”, and did it with a smile!
reviews.title: beautiful resort where money opens many doors!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a wide variety of food choices available, and nobody should leave there hungry. There were several dishes that I wouldn’t touch because I’m not that adventurous, but for a person who likes to try food from another country, this is a place to do it. At the buffet we found Dominican dishes being served as well as many American dishes. There was always a wide variety of breads, meats, desserts, fruits and veggies to choose from. We really enjoyed the Japanese restaurant, the Gormet restaurant, and the Mexican/Dominican restaurant. We preferred not to eat at the place near the beach (the steakhouse and Mexican restaurant in the Palapa Hut) because there were generally quite a few flies around.
reviews.title: Amazing Time!!

reviews.text: Beach and pool were outstanding. The room was ok but I had a hard time locking the sliding glass door and I was on the first floor. Found a few bugs in the room but like I said I was on the first floor. The food was the same everywhere and wasnt great. Alcohol was watered down it seemed but I had a great time with my friends. Their wedding was beautiful and the reception was a good time minus the food.
reviews.title: eh for all inclusive

likes.disliked: — staff didnt speak english well enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Majestic Colonial from January 8-18th, 2009. We stayed in room 4145 which is on the first floor. Our sliding doors opened up to a patio with a table, 2 chairs and 2 lounge chairs. We had about 15' of landscaping, a walkway and then a georgeous beach with a fabulous view of the ocean and most of the weddings held at the resort. On a daily basis at least 2 weddings would be held right in front of us. Our room was perfect. Large king size bed and with lots of closet space. Washroom was perfect if you are a couple, but if you are single or a new couple, this resort might not be for you. There is no privacy but it didn't bother us. The beds and pillows were the best we have ever had. We have stayed at many, many 4 and 5 star resorts in the Dominican, Mexico, Jamaica, Bahamas etc etc. I would rate the beds the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Our only complaint about the room was that they were humid however you have to put up with that when you are in the Carribean or Mexico. Sand would come under our door at night however we placed a towel or house coat on the floor to block it from blowing in further. No other complaints about the room.
reviews.title: One of the Best Resorts we have stayed at!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was the best we have experienced at any resort. We had dinner 2 nights in the Le Gourmet restaurant, steak one night and chicken the other. Service was excellent and food was perfect. We had dinner 2 nights in the Steak house. Both nights steaks were cooked exactly how we requested and service was excellent. We had breakfast a couple of mornings in the main buffet but most mornings we waited until 10:30 for the beach breakfast/lunch restaurant to open. They had a great selection and the food was hot. Lots of salads and desserts. We had dinner one evening in the Mexican Restaurant and the rest of the time was in the Main Buffet. There was lots of selection every night and the food was excellent. Lots of selection. We never came across anyone in the bars or restaurants that couldn't speak English. There english wasn't perfect but my spanish is also bad so it didn't matter. If you are polite to them, they will be polite and respectful back to you. You get what you give.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

likes.liked: — The Staff were all so happy
likes.disliked: — Boat traffic and Helicopters in the entire area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment was better than most resorts we have been at. Some shows were better than others but it was only an hour long. If you didn't want to attend the shows at 10:00 pm you could listen to a live band, and dance from 8-10 pm outside the main buffet, close to the main lobby. Everyone seems to really enjoy themself there. The casino was small and very smoky. We went in there most nights for a 10-20 minutes and didn't have much luck. They have a Disco which opens at 11:00 pm and goes til 4:00. We went 1 night and stayed until 12:30. It was fun while we were there. On evening a week they have a BBQ party on the beach with a live band and show. If you didn't like the entertainment and want a quiet evening, the main lobby bar was nice and relaxing. There is a cigar store and a jewelery store in the main lobby. You can purchase WIFI at the main lobby for $3.00 for 1 hour if you have an IPhone. Our cell phones worked perfectly the entire time we were there.
reviews.title: Wonderful Week

reviews.text: The beach is truly majestic. I believe it is the best beach that we have ever been at. You can walk for miles and miles in either direction. The beach is clean and well maintained. The water is clear and you see little fish swimming around close to the shore. We had a couple mornings were it rained but it cleared up by 10:00 am. The rest of the week was perfect. Thanks to Denny for keeping up happy with alcohol and water for the entire 10 days we were there. We never had a problem getting lounge chairs. We would puts our towel or shoes on a lounge chair around 8:30 am and there were still lots of lounge chairs available.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

likes.liked: — Customer Service was great!... Beach very clean and nice!
likes.disliked: — Wine is horrible... not drinkable... need to change wine glassware as well.

reviews.text: The resort was very nice. We had a problem with our room on check in and within 15 minutes we were moved to a much better room.
reviews.title: Great Resort but beware of FOOD
