reviews.text: We later learned as we were leaving that we were not the only ones that got sick.
reviews.title: Loved the Majestic!
"Smile Awhile"
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from 10 nights at the Marvelous Majestic. We wanted to mention a few of the employees who made our stay comfortable and fun. First, Denny the beach consierge kept our cups filled with yummy island drinks including Presidente. Then there was the sun blonde and tanned Marciella with her energetic aerobics on the beach. Our meals in the formal dining room were pleasant because of Benito and Mercedes and all of the other servers. They always had time to ask if we needed anything. Our maid took great care of our swim-up room with private jacuzi indoor and outdoor on our patio. The food was fresh and well-cooked and seasoned. We swam in the almost calm sea and walked on the long beaches every day. The pool was unique with it's winding river appearance. The employees had smiles and hugs for us when we left. Anyone who doesn't have a good time at this resort won't have a good time anywhere. We WILL return when we get a chance and hope to see our island friends again.
Vineland, New Jersey.
reviews.title: Married at Majestic!!

likes.liked: — The hotel is wonderful! The beach is great!
likes.disliked: — There is nothing not to like about the Majestic

reviews.title: Team Animation made my trip!
reviews.text: We were at the Majestic from April 19-26. We brought 55 of our friends and family for our wedding there! Aurelio, our wedding coordinator at the Majestic is the BEST! He made our wedding absolutely beautiful!!
This was our second time at the Majestic. We went two years ago and loved it so much that we decided to get married there. We have no complaints at all about this resort.
reviews.title: Great holiday

likes.liked: — The beautiful gounds and great food!
likes.disliked: — How slippery the marble floors and concrete walks can be if wet!

reviews.text: When I read some reviews, I must say, I am confused. Do people forget they are in a third world country? The food at the resort in the buffets is just okay, but it is a BUFFET! I live in Las Vegas, and the buffets here are not any better. The restaurants at the resort have excellent food. The food at my wedding reception on the beach was incrediable!!
reviews.title: yeaahhh bebe!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Majestic Colonial in the third week of February and found it to be a beautifull resort. We arrived late at night and checked in very quickly. We had a garden view room and wanted an upgrade, however, even after offering a tip, ($20), the employee still said there was no other rooms available and to return the next day. Once in the room, we found the air conditioning not working, and were eventually moved to another room, (pool view). It was difficult to communicate with some of the employee's when we tried to tell them about the problem, but eventually, we found a manager who spoke english very well and he helped us out and then some. I wish I knew his name because he was just excellent to deal with. The rooms themselves were gorgeous and spacious. The shower is amazing. The only issue I think some would have, is the privacy of the toilet. There is no privacy, LOL. Be comfortable with who you are with!!! Although not yet completed, the resort itself was stunning. Beautifull pool running straight through the resort, with plenty of bars to get a drink. I was reading another review and they said that they were charged for champaigne. We drank a ton of it, including the bottle in the room and were never charged. We ordered whatever we wanted and got no problems at all. The staff was excellent. Some didn't speak english at all, however, most made the attempt to understand and were very very impressed by their hospitality. Our room was cleaned everyday, and lots of towels and water were there when we returned from the beach. A $2 tip each day helped I think. Although all inclusive, we made sure we tipped our waiters/waitresses and bartenders. This not only helped us get better service, but these people work their butts off to make your stay is a memorable one and dont get paid very much. They will always say hello, and always have a smile on their faces, treat them well. Entertainment at night was fun. Go see Michael Jackson if you can. Overall, the resort, beach and staff are all excellent, and when fully matured, this resort will definately represent what a five star should be.
reviews.title: Great resort

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here from February 12th to the 19th, and we had a wonderful,relaxing vacation.
reviews.title: Had a Great Time

reviews.text: The pool is absolutely beautiful, and is never too crowded, but I am very much more of a beach person. For the first few days, we got up early and put our towels on the beach, but we decided that was a waste of time, as you could go down there and find chairs whenever you wanted. The beach was incredible, the nicest I've ever seen (this was my first trip to the Dominican, but I have been to Puerto Vallarta, Cancun and Mazatlan in Mexico) and it raked and cleaned throughout the day.
reviews.title: How can you complain?

reviews.text: The food was for the most part very good. I am a very picky eater, and I didn't have a problem finding things that I liked to eat. There were a few things that I was hesitant to try however.
reviews.title: Clean resort, nice beach

reviews.text: I didn't attempt to make any reservations until day 4 of our 7 day vaction. I was unable to get us into the Japanese restaurant, but we did get into the Gourmet on our last night, and our meal was fantastic. (I had the lobster au gratin, and my boyfriend had the fillet minion). The only meal we didn't enjoy was at the Chinese restaurant.
reviews.title: Gorgeous - Wonderful - Would Go Again

reviews.text: I was happy to leave the Majestic yesterday to return home for a good night sleep. The beds and pillows in room 3412 were horrible! My husband, 12 year old son and I shared the junior suite. It was huge but I felt that I was sharing a honeymoon suite with my son. There were no doors for the tub and a stall door for the toliet. We were going to upgrade to the one bedroom suite but we would have given up our wonderful view of the garden, pool, and ocean. We showered instead and lit incense while using the bathroom.
reviews.title: Sleepless at the Majestic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were no dull moments at the resort. The pool area offered entertainment, aerobics and games everyday until 6:00pm. The same type of activities were going on at the beach but this is mainly where everyone went to relax. (This is usually where my family took their naps.) If you want to drink on the beach I would suggest you bring a large insulated cup. There is a short walk to the bar and Benny is the only waiter for the entire beach.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place, had an amazing time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the stage shows take place in an outdoor theater at 10pm. It is quite warm and mosquito infested. I brought mosquito spray from home and sprayed our seating area everynight. The best show of the week was Micheal Jackson which is performed on Sundays. Don't miss it!
reviews.title: Honeymoon at Majestic

reviews.text: Overall, the food was good, the staff was friendly, many shops on the premise, an outdoor market once during the week, and most important complaints are taken care of immediately. Repeat visitors expressed this was the best resort on the beach.
reviews.title: Unforgetable Holidays

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Majestic from July 22-29. We had the most wonderful and relaxing time ever, we are allready making plans to go in 2008. We did not have any problems at all, there is not a language barrier like most I have read. They all speak english. I cannot respond in Spanish, so obviously all the staff members would have to speak English to me, which was never a problem.
reviews.title: The best in Punta Cana
Great customer service from Guest Services
reviews.text: Our stay was great. We were part of a wedding party and everyone seemed particularly pleased with the rooms, servcice and restaurants. The staff at guest services were wonderful, especially Angel Perez and Angela Anyela. Angel was particularly helpful to me in returning some personal items to us that I left behind in our room when we left. His willingness to help, and willingness to perserve on my behalf when arranging for a courrier provided to be dificult must be acknowledged. His service was beyond the oridinary, and greatly appreciated JM, Orangeville, Ontario, Canada

reviews.title: Loving the Majestic
reviews.text: I've just returned from a 12 day holiday with my boyfriend to the Majestic Colonial Punta Cana & it was fantastic...so much better than I / we had expected.

The resort itself was beautiful (true to all the pics we'd seen) & we noticed just how hard everyone works there. I felt as though they really took pride in the hotels appearance. There was somebody everyday, cleaning floors, polishing staircases, cleaning & filtering the pools, maintaining the gardens & shrubs etc. Everyone was very friendly which made it a very relaxing place to be & the Animation Team staff were superb. They work such long hours & they are full of smiles & energy all the time. They don't pressure you into joining in with any of the games, however, if you do decide to take part, they are full of encouragement. Its not nice to pick favourites, but the people who stood out for me was HENRY, RAY, MELVIN, WALTER & EVALISA. They welcomed us every morning with big smiles, jokes, friendly banter & made us not want to leave! Their English was brilliant also. We will defintely be going back & we just hope that when we do, they are all still there.
reviews.title: A+ resort! The Majestic was top notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our hotel seemed to be very popular for weddings, there was a wedding nearly everyday & they all looked amazing. The weather was great, very very hot, with a one or two welcomed cloudy days.
reviews.title: Ignore the negative reviews!

likes.disliked: — Nothing regarding the actual accommodation, just the lounger hogs (when claiming a sun and a shade one)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative point I would make is about the Mini Market. Not only is it very overpriced in there, but the staff are very rude & unhelpful & at times could be very intimidating. I heard that they are independant staff & not direct staff of the Majestic Hotel, so just bare that in mind! Other than that, I couldn't fault it! :o)
reviews.title: the very best!

reviews.text: We found the hotel grounds excellent, the rooms were beautiful, The service was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and willing to make your stay the best. My niece was married at the resort and the day of the wedding the electricity went out for several hours. The hotel went out of its way to save the day. The wedding party had planned spa treatments and hair appointments at the hotel. The staff arranged for the wedding party to have another hotel take care of them. It worked out perfect.
reviews.title: Majestic Colonial was beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only concern is that many of us became sick at different times during our stay. Out of 32 people 10 us became ill. We were warned not to eat any of the salad foods or use the sink water to brush our teeth. Many of us in the group became ill during our visit. Six of us became very ill for the first few days after returning home. The symptoms included headache, nausea, constipation and diarrhea. It is an amazing place; but, you need to be very careful what you eat. We all tried to resist the beautiful salads but we ate them more towards the end of our stay.
reviews.title: Could be better..

likes.liked: — Angela the manager at public relations, the scenary oh and Fernando for the photo session very nice as well...
likes.disliked: — Food, cleanliness(cleaned my room late pm), drinks and activities...

reviews.text: I had my family stayed for a week early February, so therefore I was tempted to visit since they raved so well about this resort..First of all the food is not the best, there isn't much variety, yes indeed the room does smell like mold and there is buildup, the furniture was stained, the drinks were dull..however they do compensate their weaknesss with their staff.. I went with my partner and I wished to surprised her with some romantic gestures throughout our stay, As I approached Public Relations I was introduced to ANGELA..so hospitable, friendly, and surely did make me feel pleased..she went an extra mile to please each and every of my request. Iasked to have the jacuzzi filled with rose pedals, and set a romantic tone in my room..she diged everywhere for pedals, I asked for honey( a little spark for the mood!!!) she got me honey, got candles and a bottle of champagne..she personally went to the room herself and did it..she did an awesome job. oh and a fruit platter not bad...afterwards the next morning i had set up a romantic breakfast and asked her to get me orange juice and champagne for a mimosa..as she did and very punctual..if anyone visits this resort and needs an additional service for whatever kind please dont hesitate and go see her, she will accomplish it. If for any reason I will return I sure hope she is there, outstanding employee they should all be like her..because when I approach front desk some of the girls were rude and the activity womens aren't as friendly, the males are friendlier..they should all get some lessons from Angela..
reviews.title: Majestic Colonial Punta Cana

reviews.text: We just returned from our stay at the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana. The resort, and the island in general, was wonderful! The grounds and buildings are gorgeous, the staff is amazing and the beach is breathtaking. Our room was very nice (although it did have a bit of a mildew smell so bring an air freshener). We liked the Japanese and French restaurants the best, and the steak house was also good. Many people have complained about the food, but we were able to get pretty good meals almost every time we ate.
reviews.title: Loved the Majestic

likes.liked: — Every member of the Staff was friendly and willing to assist you with all your needs.

reviews.text: I can't say enough about how awesome the staff were. Denny, our beach concierge, would meet me every morning under my umbrella on the beach for our morning conversation in Spanish (his idea to help me brush up on my Spanish). He never let our drinks get warm, or empty! Eddie the DJ was another amazing employee at the hotel! He made the wedding reception we were at just amazing!
reviews.title: Enjoyed our rum, er, time, in Punta Cana

reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a fantastic vacation at the MC. We were so impressed with the elegance of the resort. We stayed for one week and had a very relaxing vacation.
reviews.title: Wow !! we were very impressed

reviews.text: The ocean was very beautiful. A turqoise color. There were many fish to see if snorkeling is your thing. I would recommend that you go out early in the morning before the speed boats start going back and forth.
reviews.title: Great resort and beautiful beach

reviews.text: Our room was great. It was very big and clean. The maid came every morning and our fridge was stocked daily.
reviews.title: You have to out of your mind not to like this place
Great sun, great fun!
reviews.text: The food was amazing !!! We especially enjoyed the buffet for breakfast and lunch. For dinner we usually went to one of their restaurants on the resort. The beach restaurant was very good. I recommend the Chateau Briand with baked potato and sour cream. We also went to the Gourmet restaurant. It was delicious as well. We had the filet mignon.

reviews.title: Bad bad bad
reviews.text: The atmosphere is so... friendly there. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and always a smile on there faces. They would always greet you with a "hola!" My goodness they work hard over there. One hostess I got to know a little told me that she works 12 days on and has 3 days off. Her hours were from 7 am to 9 pm.
We've been to all-inclusives before, but this was by FAR my favorite, and I can't wait to come back again!
reviews.title: Excellent Kids Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I begin.... My husband and I (along with another couple)went to the Majestic from Apr. 24th-May 1st/08. Totally amazing! I know people are entitled to their opinion... so here's ours.... Ignore the negative reviews!!! You couldn't get much closer to perfect than this resort for many reasons. I think "some" people aren't happy and find negativity in "anything".
reviews.title: Amazing staff and amazing resort!!!!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff and great animation team
likes.disliked: — mini market was terrible. Staff were the rudest i've ever met!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from our stay at the Majestic. We were there from Feb. 7th - 11th. Since I booked this trip six months ago I had a lot of time to read the reviews on Trip Advisor. Like others before me mentioned, the reviews at either end of the spectrum (i.e., worst resort ever or the best resort in the world) should be taken with a grain of salt. Clearly the Majestic is a nice place and probably one of the best in Punta Cana. But it also has its flaws and is definitely NOT the 5 star resort it's oftentime advertised as.
reviews.title: Overall, a nice resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival - Our flight arrived in the late afternoon on a Thursday. Many reviews have stressed the importance of not taking pre-arranged shuttles from the airport. I booked mine way in advance and really didn't feel like making changes so we took the shuttle. We had no problems. No waiting in long lines at the airport or anything like that. The van was very comfortable. There were only 6 of us with 4 going to the Majestic and 2 going to the RIU Palace (two resorts down the beach) so it wasn't as if we were making a ton of stops. I'm pretty sure the transfer would have been worse had we arrived on a Friday or Saturday. I'd keep that in mind when booking.
reviews.title: Applause, applause, applause for Majestic Colonial

likes.liked: — Beauty of resort, excellent, dedicated, friendly staff, lovely room.
likes.disliked: — Bed comfort (a little firm for me).

reviews.text: Check-In - Again, this seemed to be a major complaint by many of the negative reviewers. We were fortunate to arrive in the late afternoon so the lobby was nearly deserted of new arrivals. We were greeted by the famous Victor who was as advertised - very accommodating and professional. He not only checked us in but escorted us to the dinner reservations desk and walked us through making reservations for the week. He then accompanied us all the way to our room which was at the other end of the resort nearest the beach - probably a 10 minute walk. He explained the room's amenities and what was included in our package and explained the layout of the resort. It was all very professional and much appreciated. I'm not sure why we received the royal treatment by the manger (or one of the managers) of the resort. All of the arriving guests I saw had to find their rooms on their own. I think the service we received was due to a) the lack of guests checking in at the time we arrived and b) the fact that I called the resort 4 times in the previous month to confirm my reservation and also emailed them the week prior (as others have recommended). Check-in could not have gone better.
reviews.title: In serious withdrawal
Don't Believe It
reviews.text: Room - We had an ocean view suite in building 2 - room 2154. The room was very nice and well situated. No foul odor or exposed wires as reported by other reviewers. I would recommend for those staying in an ocean front suite to request a room on the second or third floor for optimum ocean views. We were on the ground floor and could see the ocean ok, but the second floor would have been nicer. One tip: Confirm on arrival what plan you have. I wasn't aware that I had purchased the 'Supreme Package' which gave us free room service (not included in the standard all-inclusive) and premium alcohol. No complaints about the room.

reviews.title: loved the grounds of the Majestic
reviews.text: Grounds - The resort's grounds are immaculate. There is no doubt that the grounds crew does a wonderful job maintaining a beautiful landscape.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for our honeymoon June 23-28. We had a wonderful time. I've previously been a Mexico person, but decided to travel to Punta Cana this time around.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was fabulous! We just stayed the in junior suite and overlooked the HUGE pool. The room was cleaned daily and we always had what we needed. The grounds were beautiful and very well kept. Everything was in bloom. The staff works very hard to keep the resort and ground in tip top shape.
reviews.title: Excellent time at the Majestic!

reviews.text: The pool was so cool. Probably my favorite part of the vacation. It was just huge and so neat how it ran through the resort. There was entertainment by the pool everyday as well and there was always plenty of chairs.
reviews.title: Words can not express the joys of the Majestic!!!!

likes.disliked: — the outdoor theater could use some fans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was soft white sand and the ocean a turquoise color. The water was very rough at our resort, but when we ventured our on our snorkeling trip, we noticed other parts of the island were much more calm. Time of year or just area resort is located? Not sure. There were also always more than enough beach chairs too. I wasn't as "in love" with the water here as much as in Mexico. The water in Mexico is a bright blue and here was just ok.
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort

likes.liked: — The jacuzzi tub and the wonderful service.

reviews.text: Entertainment was great. Club, casino, music in evenings, shows, etc. When you go to P.C., you seem to be confined to your resort. You can leave via taxi, but we didn't. I didn't feel comfortable doing that and it was going to cost quite a bit. We always found something to do in the evening while we sipped our drinks. Only complaint with drinks is that we never had the same one twice, meaning no bartender made them the same. We were mainly drinking strawberry daquris and they never tasted the same. Not a big deal, but something to be aware of.
reviews.title: Wonderful All-inclusive

likes.liked: — The availability of the restaurants, the pool chairs, etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was infested with mosquitos and roaches and had an unpleasant odor. Management agreed to change our room, but we found even more roaches and mosquitos in the second room. My husbnad and I found ourselves killing bugs during our whole stay. Mangement offered us room service and I got a free manicure, but we would have rather had a bug free room. The resort only served one type of beer and the frozen mixed drinks were not good. Some of the staff were not friendly and very few spoke english. The pool was the best part of the trip.
reviews.title: We Had Cock Roaches In Our Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My stay was supposed to be from Friday, August 15-August 22nd. I had a terrible time flying American Airlines from NYC with a connection at Miami. Please do not fly anywhere near Miami Airport and I highly recommend the avoidance of American Airlines altogether. They had the nerve to cancel our flight by blaming it on the "tropical storm fay". If they cancelled the flight due to weather, why did they give us a free hotel stay and food voucher? They could only give us the accommodations if it is there fault (which we didn't realize until after the fact). The following day when we were supposed to depart, they delayed our flight 6 hours because they could not get pilots to fly the plane. American Airlines took away two days from my vacation at Majestic because of their incompetence.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort!

reviews.text: Thankfully, the Majestic Colonial slowly made up for the horrible journey to the resort. At first, I thought I was in a nightmare when I settled into the room. My boyfriend and I received a "junior suite double bed with a garden view". In actuality it was a junior suite with a view of the construction site of the new Majestic Elegance. While settling into the room at 12:30 am in the morning (thanks to the late arrival from American Airlines) we found many glitches that affected my view of this resort, not for the better. I was disappointed because I had high expectations of this resort prior to my arrival. I read a great number of reviews about this resort and was expecting a spectacular room. What I found in the first 5 minutes of inspection was an in-room-safe that did not work; a lamp next to the bed that did not work; a pillow that had a stain that looked like somebody had stepped on it with a boot; and to top it off, my boyfriend stepped outside in the garden to take in the view of the construction site when he fell because his foot got stuck in a 1-2 feet deep hole. His fall could have caused him a twisted ankle or a shin splint, but thankfully that did not happen.
reviews.title: Hear it is...the absolute truth about the Majestic

likes.disliked: — Nothing enough to make a comment

reviews.text: Oh yeah, I also received a few mosquito bites while surveying the room, but we're in a tropical resort so that is expected.
reviews.title: Managing your expectations is the key to good vacation at the Majestic

likes.disliked: — The beds and pillows! Lack of activities for kids

reviews.text: I took my complaint to the night manager, Calix, who did a wonderful job handling my case. I have to hand it to him, he is a very patient person; he just finished listening to a wonderful lady from Scotland who had a few too many drinks and was relentlessly pressuring Calix into providing a raise to a waiter named Nelson because of his exceptional service. Unfortunately that is not possible and he spent 30 minutes trying to convey that message to her with no avail. In any event, all my complaints that I had written down and given to Calix were fixed. I had asked him if he could provide us with another room with a King sized bed. I was sad when he couldn't offer us one for that night. But then he redeemed himself when he provided us with a majestic suite with direct pool access the next day.
reviews.title: I had the time of my life

likes.disliked: — The casino was not the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to try a new location this year other than Aruba and we were very pleased with this hotel choice. The staff were very pleasant, the grounds were clean and tended to daily. The beach was awesome with plenty of palapas.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure to stay at the presidential suite with two private balconies and a outdoor jacuzzi. Great party room!
reviews.title: Great Value! Great Service! Food not Majestic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants were Ok...
reviews.title: AMAZING Resort, AMAZING Staff, yet most humbling trip of my life!

likes.liked: — Pool, beach, location, nice rooms, many bars and restaurants to choose from!
likes.disliked: — Bathroom set up, some food not labeled, nothing major.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Japanese was overbooked and we couldn't enjoy the hibachi. The French reastaurant was decent, but was abandoned after the sommelier sold us his wine chioce. The only positive we had was an attentive young waiter.
reviews.title: VERY ROMANTIC

likes.disliked: — Not enough umbrellas at pool area

reviews.text: The best experience was the Mexican/Domincan restaurant where we met Rafael & Milsolidia. They were very nice to us from picture taking to a little homemade backyard after drink (Mamajuana). Will send pictures soon!
reviews.title: so so

reviews.text: Here goes my review - Traveled May 19th - 25th. This was our 4th time to the DR. Having stayed before at the Iberostar Bavaro and Iberostar LaRomana. This was a graduation gift to our two daughters 21 and 25 (lst time for them to DR). My brother and his wife also decided to join us.
reviews.title: Great Time at Majestic!!!

likes.disliked: — For a hotel rated 5 star, I think the food quality needs to be higher

reviews.text: Rooms - We had three different room categories between us. Thank you Richard for all your help. My husband and I had a Col. Jr. Suite, the girls had a swim-up room and my brother and his wife had a standard room. All rooms had identical furniture. Our room (1420) had was bigger because we had two balconies. One was for the rooftop hot tub, which we only used twice, it was way too hot up there. The other balcony overlooked the resort next door and had a partial oceanview. Would I pay again for this room upgrade. No. My brother and his wife had a great standard room (2334) overlooking the pool area. My daughters had the swim-up room (2148), great location, near the beach and the beginning of the pool. I had requested for them a room with two double beds, this room had a king bed. They decided not to switch. Their only issue with the room was that they had quite a few mosquitos in room. I think it was because it was due to the fact they were on the lst floor with the grassy area in front that got watered daily and was in the shade. We had no mozzies nor did my brother. The girls did not use their outdoor hot tub (really no privacy) and I also made a point to check the other swim-up roomsm I never saw anyone use their hot tub. The girls would go back late in the day and use the lounge chairs to read. We all had champagne in room upon arrival. Also, during the week we all received white wine, red wine, fruit platter, cheese platter, sushi, salmon and grapes delivered to our room. Letters welcoming us and we also received hats and shirts. We also all had slippers and robes in the rooms. I thought that my water pressure in the huge shower could have been alot better. As far as the room categories go, I really think any room would be great for us if we went again. How much time do you really spend in the room? We would be gone by 8:00am til 5:30pm, back out again at 7:00pm til 9:30 or 10:00pm. I know we are party poopers, the sun just wiped us out.
reviews.title: Amazing Vacation

likes.disliked: — For people that have a hard time walking, this resort might be difficult because it is so big and there is a lot of walking from place to place. The only other thing I could suggest is working on the kids club and making it a little more exciting for the kids.

reviews.text: Speaking of the weather, it was great. Someone on the plane said it showed showers all week in the forecast. It sprinkled lightly one night during the beach barbeque and then once more sometime through the night. The weather was hot. We were almost hoping for some relief from clouds.
reviews.title: Great Service!!!

likes.disliked: — THE STAY WAS TOO SHORT, I LOVED EVERYTHING!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We never had a problem getting beach chairs. I don't know if it was just the week. There were always chairs at the beach no matter what time. We would stay on the beach til around 3:30 or 4:00 and then head up to the pool bar area. Never had a problem getting a few chairs around the pool except on Miss Bikini Contest day. (Though on our last morning, I saw the pool guys take away alot of the loungers around the pool. I don't know where he was bringing them) On a side note, I have to say my tuition payments to college paid off as my younger daughter went to the finals against her sister at the Beer Drinking contest and won!!! (It was who could drink the fastest) She made us proud, I say jokingly.
reviews.title: Coming Back For More!
Perfect Vacation!
reviews.text: The beach was beautiful. That is what we went for. The ocean was great. There was a few rocks right in front, not a problem though. We stayed on the beach all day and enjoyed the ocean. The pool was nice too, but you can have a pool anywhere. The ocean was much more refreshing than the pool, also a wonderful breeze on the beach.

reviews.title: loved the majestic
reviews.text: Hotel & location lovely - right on the beach. The first day met Denny, the beach concierge who was friendly & helpful. We looked forward to seeing him daily. Also, Francisco Paulino, general mgr. was very helpful & friendly (as were so many of the staff) he went out of his way to try to accomodate our party of 6.

I am NOT EASILY PLEASED! I’m a clean freak, and have discerning tastes in all things. And the MAJESTIC was AMAZING!!! My husband and I looked forward to this special family trip with our daughter, newly married son and daughter-in-law for months, and every expectation was exceeded…FAR EXCEEDED! This is a tropical, developing country. I didn’t expect things to be perfect, but they were as perfect as we humans have a right to expect, anywhere…especially for the price.
reviews.title: Sincere Thanks for a Dream Vacation!
Ohhhh My Lord, Yeahhh "Paradise Found"
reviews.text: Beautiful, blue ocean water and soft white sand was our priority, and this beach met our expectations. You can walk for miles in either direction, and we did! We noticed that the Majestic beach was kept cleaner of seaweed than those of the other resorts we passed. The lounge chairs, palapas and palm trees are much closer up to the water than the other resorts, and were so neatly arranged and maintained…straightened each afternoon. Catamarans, kayaks, snorkel equipment and boogie boards are all available without extra cost, and were great fun! Wear the water shoes though…we had one kayak overturn and our daughter had cuts on her feet and legs from the coral.

I can’t understand why people would not think the food is superb! The buffets offered dozens of choices. Each item is not for everybody, because they are feeding people from many different cultures and parts of the world. When we saw something that looked unappealing to us, we assumed that it is a dish that is very appealing in another country. We found plenty of delicious choices. I did feel the lobby buffet was better than the beach buffet for lunch, with more options. I’ve read many comments that the food is cold. Omelets, crepes, grilled sandwiches, and pasta are all cooked while you go through the line, so there are plenty of hot choices available. The pasta is heated up in skillets, with the sauce and extra ingredients you choose (cheese, veggies, etc.), so are made to order, and the wait is never long. The variety of fresh breads and rolls alone was incredible. Orange juice in the morning is fresh squeezed and there are other tropical juices like papaya and watermelon. Ask for cappuccino when coffee is offered…it comes with lots of frothy, creamy milk on top. While the buffets are great, we found the rule to be that the food was even better in the restaurants. We read so many positive comments about the steakhouse, and it did not disappoint; the Chateaubriand and Sirloin were both great. The gourmet restaurant was wonderful…the pumpkin-coconut soup was delicious…it didn’t taste to me like either pumpkin OR coconut, but was awesome. The Japanese restaurant was fabulous…the show was SO MUCH FUN! It was my husband’s birthday, and the cooks and staff sang & danced the most wonderful caribbean rendition of ‘Happy Birthday To You’ imaginable, complete with the pounding of symbols on the wall! We went to the Japanese restaurant a second time (the non-show main area) and it was amazing also. Oriental food is not my favorite, but this was great, and truly gourmet. I skipped the sushi bar, but it looked beautiful. Wine & water glasses at all of the restaurants are constantly being refilled…coffee is offered also.
reviews.title: A Highlight of... let's see: My Life?! =)

Also I noticed that the glass doors in the shower and the toilet area did not get touched by the cleaning crew and we were there from the 17th to the 25th but other than that it was great. We were a family of 4 (incl 2 teenagers) who stayed at the Majestic March 21 - 28. In summary, we had a fantastic vacation. We were looking for relaxation and escape from hectic schedules, and we found it. The beach is amazing, the water warm and the waves great for boogie boarding. The pool is incredible - just pick your spot based on how much exercise you want (i.e. the distance to get to the swim-up bar). Those multiple trips to the swim-up bar, and long walks on the beach were the only exercise I got.

reviews.text: The rooms are beautiful - quite luxurious. We found the bed very comfortable and we slept quite well. The only complaint is that the toilet in the room could be made a bit more private (they should use solid doors and walls from floor to ceiling). We enjoyed the big jacuzzi tub - especially because our kids had a separate room...). We were in first floor rooms in the 4000 block - close to the beach and the pool. Very quiet with a nice open courtyard with fountains outside. At the back, we had a view of the ocean through the trees on the adjacent vacant lot. We had asked for two nearby rooms - one with two double beds (for our kids) and one with a king bed (for us - yeah baby!). We got exactly the configuration we asked for, and the two rooms were adjacent - perfect.

reviews.text: I cannot even begin to explain how incredible our stay at the Majestic Colonial was.. when they say 5 star resort they don't lie. From the moment we arrived at the resort and stepped off our bus we were greeted by staff passing out cool face clothes and majestic drinks and cookies... I soon realized this was only a small glimpse into the amazing treatment I would be receiving for the next 7 days of my stay! Whether it was at the bar by the pool or at one of the many restaurants, the staff at Majestic were continually warm and friendly and providing great service at all hours of the day. I was fully assured that my family picked the right resort when mid week I had a craving for a very American food (grilled cheese sandwiches), and to my disbelief they actually had them at the lunch buffet cooked right in front of me so it was nice and hot! With five different restaurants serving wide assortments of food, you never have to worry about going hungry. If my experience wasn't already great enough it was certainly heightened by the wonderful, fully energetic team of animators who provide all sorts of activities from 10 in the morning till after 10 at night; getting you involved and ensuring that you are entertained.. They even get you doing things you would never fathom doing back at home (like entering into a bikini contest) and make you feel great the whole time! Although they meet thousands of people and probably wouldn't remember me if I am privileged enough to return, I will never forget those animators.. I learned to dance a little bit better at the late night disco thanks to my great animator friend Jesus, I got my butt kicked during stretching and pool aerobics (just a few of the MANY activities they provided throughout the day) by Francisco, and was wildly entertained on the beach volleyball court by Walter (aka. Mosquito, the humerus little firecracker).. they are amazing people!! This review doesn't even begin to explain every terrific aspect of my experience at the Majestic Colonial, cause if it did it would be far to long for anyone to read.. But I would highly recommend this resort to anyone as it is fully looked after by gardeners, maids, security and grounds keepers working all hours of the day to make it look outstanding, it has beaches you can only dream of, has staff that provides you with unimaginable service, going above and beyond what they're paid to do, and provides both relaxation and entertainment so any type of person is satisfied with their stay. It is more then picture perfect and certainly a place you will never forget!
reviews.title: An Absolute Dream.

reviews.text: I had a great time at the Majestic, my bell hop Julio Salomon went to extremes in order to make my stay a great one, i really apreciate the fact that he went the extra mile.
reviews.title: Majestic trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second visit to the Majestic. My first was two years ago. This resort is absolutely gorgeous and it might very well be one of the prettiest resorts on the entire island. The food is OK, but not great. Breakfast was by far my favorite meal. My husband is an extremely picky eater and he always found something to eat. As far as the food is concerned, I've always wondered why they don't have a restaurant that is dedicated to just serving Dominican food. The Taino restaurant for some odd reason had a Dominican buffet, but serves mexican food off of the menu. The Mexican food is not very good. In my opinion, they should stick to good old fashioned Dominican cooking at the Taino restaurant b/c I'm sure that many people would love to experience a typical dominican meal.
reviews.title: Still Beautiful

reviews.text: There were a couple of things that I found had changed from my last visit. During my first visit, the frozen drinks were actually frozen. This time around the drinks were watery as they came out of the machines and the bartenders added crushed ice. Not a big deal for me, but if you a big fan of frozen drinks, you will be disappointed. Also, the power went out at least once every day, once again, this wasn't a big deal for me but I do remember that during my first trip the we never lost power (maybe it has something to do with the resort being at full capacity). If all you care about is relaxing and enjoying the beautiful surroundings, then this is the resort for you.

Then we would go to the shows and the disco at night and they were there doing it all. Such a wonderful group of guys to be around. If we knew the same guys would be there next time-we would not hesitate to go back to the same place. We did not bring our kids with us on this trip and wish we would have. There are fun things for all ages.

Absolutely the best hotel you can ask for!!!!
reviews.text: We stayed in a Majestic Colonial Junior Suite which includes and indoor jacuzzi, outdoor jacuzzi, and your own personal "yard" which gives you direct access to the pool. The rooms are spacious and have a nice layout. The bed is a bit on the hard side, but I personally enjoyed that. I will agree with everyone that says the bathroom stall is small, almost tiny, but who would base their decision on the size of a bathroom. The space in the shower makes up for it though. The jacuzzis are pretty small for two people, but is that's your thing I guess you'll make due. Maid cleaned every day, but sometimes not until 4-5pm, and did only leave washcloths twice during the week.

reviews.title: Wonderfull

reviews.text: My husband, myself and three other family members visited the Majestic from 6/28-7/4. Prior to leaving for our trip I was in contact with the manager, AnneMarie, regarding our preferences for rooms. Upon arriving at the resort, Victor at the front desk called AnneMarie who personally greeted us, checked us in at her private desk, made our dinner reservations, and gave us a personal tour of the resort. She escorted us to our room, 2248, and it was a great location, closest to the beach with an almost full ocean view. Thanks AnneMarie!!
reviews.title: Happy with the Majestic!

reviews.text: It's important to understand the layout of the hotel and how the room numbers go in order to put in a request for a specific room location. Building 1 faces the hotel next door, building 2 faces the pool, with some ocean views. The 1st floor rooms in building 2 are the Colonial Junior Suites with slider doors opening up to the pool. Our other family members had these rooms, but never really utilized their pool access from their room. The only difference in their room versus ours, which was a Standard Junior Suite, was that they had a DVD player and a clock in their room. They would have preferred a room on the 2nd, 3rd or 4th floors. Building 3 also faces the pool but has no 1st floor pool access and building 4 faces the construction of their new hotel. Room numbers in all buildings go from 1 to 52? The higher the number, the closer to the ocean. For example, our room 2248, was in building 2 (represented by the first 2), was on the 2nd floor (represented by the second 2) and was room 48 (the last 2 numbers). So if you want a room closest to the ocean, ask for a room in the 40's or 50's.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very nice, a little musty and the comforter had some mildew on it, but no big deal. After all, you are in a tropical, humid environment. We did have an issue with some bugs in our room, not an infestation of any kind, I just can't stand to see them at all, especially in the place where I have to sleep! I killed numerous mosquitos, a couple of roach looking critters, and many small ants around our sink area. You may want to pack some bug spray as well, we did get numerous mosquito bites in the evening, especially at the open-aired restaurants. We only had washclothes in our room the first day, but I had brought my own from home, so it wasn't a big deal for me. The hotel does provide shampoo, conditioner, bodywash and a good working hairdryer so no need to pack these. You also get robes and slippers.
reviews.title: Not sure what all the negativity is about???

likes.liked: — Jacuzi in the room separate from bathroom.
likes.disliked: — No bottles of booze in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say I was a little nervous about the food at the resort after reading some recent reviews. We thought the food was fine, but we did not eat any fruits or vegetables just to be on the safe side. Lunch was the hardest meal for me to find something good to eat. They do have a pasta bar and panini station at the poolside buffet which were ok. Some of our family members ate at the indoor buffet and said lunch was much better there, but I didn't want to trek up there everyday and have to change into dry clothes before doing so. Around 3:30, the poolside buffet restaurant does put out some pizza, nachos and cheese and other snack foods, so I just waited to eat those instead of having lunch most days. We tried all the restaurants for dinner except the main buffet. Food and service was usually pretty good. There were many weddings when we were there and sometimes their receptions were in the same restaurants that we were eating in. This was the only time service was not up to par, because the staff was overwhelmed at these times. The drinks were pretty good as well, my favorite was the Majestic (with Stoli!). Some top shelf liquor is not included so ask before you order if you're not sure. None of us got sick at all or had any major stomache issues.
reviews.title: A wonderful vacation

likes.disliked: — The toilet area was not private enough

reviews.text: Entertainment was decent. There was a PG-13 movie every night in the sports bar which was good to kill time, and then at 10:00pm the nightly entertainment starts in the theatre. Shows were pretty good, though sometimes we were too tired to stay and watch the whole thing. Never went to the disco, but did go to the casino a couple of times, it was small, but fun. There is a games area and small gym across from the theatre, and also some shops. At 11:00pm a small snack shop opens across from the theatre for those with the late night munchies! The animation team at the resort does a great job. Everyday they had activities planned on the beach and around the pool. They were very professional, energetic and are hard workers, working very long days!

reviews.text: The rooms were nice and big. The bathroom was oddly designed but your modesty can easily be thrown out the window after a couple coco-loco cocktails. We stayed in 2152 which was beach front and only a few steps from the pool too. We had the jacuzzi tub on our patio but it was never used. I recommend any of the beach front or pool front rooms.

reviews.title: A beautiful restful vacation
reviews.text: The entertainment staff was outstanding and offered much to do during the day. They were very friendly and made everyone feel included. The pool bar activities were always a good time. The kids club staff was great as well. My nephews hung out there most of the day with kids of all ages and nationalites. Somehow the staff was creative enough to keep everyone interested and involved. The shows at night weren't that great but the theatre set up was awesome. Comfy seats and great visibility to the stage. It was fun just to sit relax and drink before heading to the casino or disco.

reviews.title: majestic paradise

reviews.text: My family recently stayed at the Majestic Colonial for a family vacation. We have never encountered such an accomodating, friendly wonderful staff! Everyone could not do enough for us! Unfortunately we don't remember everyones names, but Franchesco stood out as one of the animators there, He made dancing, water volleyball, and other activities a blast! From the staff at the lobby, to the bathroom attendant Lourdes, everyone was helpful, friendly and polite! The gentlemen who ran the shows daily at 10:00 PM was awesome! Daily shows and activities is something we looked forward to everyday! Drinks and food were plentiful. We especially enjoyed the Japanese restaurant. We were amazed at the cleaniness of the hotel, including the beach! Rose, our cleaning woman would thoughtfully fill our jacuzzi daily with bubble bath and lined it with flowers for an added touch! We recommend this hotel to anyone, and would definately come back for a visit!

reviews.text: We visited Majestic Colonial for a wedding and week long vacation. The staff did an excellent job decorating and the ceremony was held in the beautiful gazeebo in the middle of the resort. It was perfect. For the rest of the week the animation team kept the party going with their dancing and numerous activities, including the poolside aerobics. Special shout out to Francisco, Walter (aka Mosquito Boy), Jesus, Nina, Yan and Elsa. Also the service by the bartenders was top notch. Joseph and Victor kept the drinks coming with permanent smiles, and hooked us up with some Dominican specialties. I would love to visit Majestic Colonial again. The people were incredible and ensured that everyone enjoyed their vacation to the fullest. I hope to see them again soon!

reviews.text: Transportation:

Enroute you will each fill out the Dom. Rep. immigration form. If the flight attendant will do it, grab TWO per person, because it is the exact same form you will need for departure immigration. You will be way ahead of the game if you fill them both out. The line for departure immigration is slow only because of people filling out the forms and you can go by them.

reviews.text: The arrival part of the airport is very nice and well laid out. Have your ten dollars per person out and pay at the first table. You will then go through a very quick passport stamping and exit to the modern baggage area. The customs area is a wave through, so no slowdown there.

reviews.text: We just came back from the Majestic Colonial this Friday night. We stayed there from Nov. 30 thru Dec. 7th. We were a party of 11 (6 adults, 4 small children, and 1 toddler). This was mine and my husband’s 3rd trip to Punta Cana. In previous years we stayed at Iberostar Dominicana and Gran Bahia Principe. We love the Dominican weather and beach, but the food at the resorts not so much. The food at the Mexican All inclusive resorts is much better (that’s why Mexico is more expensive).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won’t go over the airport, the weather, or anything else that has nothing to do with the resort. The point of this review is to tell you about the resort…which has no control over such things as the weather (I actually saw people giving bad reviews because it rained).
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: First of all I would like to give a big thank you to Emily! I sent her an e-mail approx. 2 weeks before our arrival detailing our requests. Because of all the reviews that I read, I knew to stay away from rooms in buildings 1 and 4 (the view from building 1 is to the parking lot of another resort, while the lovely view from building 4 is to the lovely construction site of the new resort being built). We requested our 3 rooms to be in one building and in building #2 if available. Needless to say, not only were we all in one building, but we did get really great rooms in building #2. Two of the rooms were on the first floor (rooms 2127 and 2131) with 2 Jacuzzis (though they say no kids are allowed in those rooms) and had their own access to the pool. The 3rd room was on the 2nd floor (2215) also with a view to the beautiful pool.
reviews.title: Great vacation overall!!
Rivals Sandals
reviews.text: The rooms are just like in the pictures…they truly are 5 star rooms. The pool, the beach, and all the grounds are truly spectacular. However, though food was abundant, it wasn’t very good. I think that star rating should not be given based on rooms alone. I would not give this resort a 5 star. It was no better than the Gran Bahia Principe or Iberostar, or even where we stayed in Mexico at Iberostar Paraiso Del Mar, Iberostar Tucan. The only difference was the rooms. So basically we paid $400 more per person just because the rooms had a Jacuzzi.

I’m not trying to say that the MC is a bad resort; it’s just not what everyone hyped it up to be. It’s not better than the cheaper 4 star resorts. If you are a couple traveling alone or with friends, you will have a really great time. But, this place was definitely not built with kids in mind. Yes, it accommodates children, but unlike the Iberostar chains (for example), it was built with honeymooners in mind. When they started building this resort they must have meant for it to be couples only, but then decided that they would lose out big time if they didn’t make it a family resort (IMO). The children’s’ play area (the castle and kids club) is way way out of the way. It is far from the beach and pool (I guess so as not to disturb the adult guests). In the other 4 star resorts that I’ve been to, the children’s’ playground (and kiddie pool) was in the same area as the adult pool and close to the beach. So that this way, both adults and children can have fun together. In the MC there was a kiddie pool (not playground) also in the same area as the huge pool, but it was by the bar, where all the daily activities were going on. Also, we went to the “castle” and into the kids club, which, by the way, looked very dreary. They didn’t even have a diaper changing area. I needed to change my baby’s diaper and asked the kiddie care provider where I can do this, she told me in the bathroom. Where did she expect me to change his diaper? In the toilet? There was no table! Just a few stalls and a sink. In fact, NONE of the bathrooms in the resort had changing stations.

reviews.text: Summary: If you are absolutely set on visiting Punta Cana, the Majestic Colonial is not a bad place to say as long as you lower your expectations - Specifically, you will not be dissapointed if you expect a 2-star start hotel. You will be fairly dissapointed if you expect a 3-star resort. And, you will be extremely dissapointed if you're expecting a stay in a 4-star or better resort.

reviews.text: The resort is beautiful, seems they have more facilities than guests so you really never have a wait or feel you can’t locate that perfect place to rest your rear under the sun. I do have to say the food was hit or miss, hey but that was ok…there were so many food choices that if you didn’t like what you had you could just go get something else. You have to remember the Dominican Republic as a whole is not known as a culinary capitol, but there certainly were enough food choices. Many folks we spoke to throughout our stay all had favorites, some we agreed with and some not…A few things we all agreed upon were, The Chinese Food was pretty bad, and the best Drinks were at the Lobby Bars. If you go to the upstairs bar during the day go see Riccardo and at night see Paublo, both are Drink Mixing Masters and the nicest guys you’ll meet. Also make it a point to have some of the Beach Piaya on the day it’s prepared and served on the beach, man was that good.

reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic. The hotel is fantastic, the property is beautiful and the service was unbeatable. We travel on average twice yearly and stay only in 4 or 5 star resorts, and Majestic Colonial didn't let us down. I'd done some research prior to coming, and the reviews didn't do the property or service justice. We have a 10 year-old daughter and she had a ball too! We highly recommend the Kids Club, Magalie was phenominal. We don't typically use the kids camps, but our daughter loved the camp and Magalie took care of the kids as if they were her own. She's a definite asset to the staff. Our daughter played during the day and danced nightly at the young adult (8-12 yr olds) club. What a great program.

The food and spa were also excellent. We ate at 5 of the 8 restaurants and got messages on the beach. We couldn't have asked for a better vacation. The weather was perfect, always a breeze; our room was spacious and we had no problems. The refrigerator was well stocked and the staff were both friendly and

reviews.title: A very beautiful hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I were at Majestic Colonial with two more couples from February 10 - 24. We were very impressed with the lovely room. Very large with a separate spa bath. A large walk-in shower, a king size bed and a beautiful patio. We were on the opposite side of the pool but enjoyed it, as it was more quiet. The room services were very good. I have learned from this experience that bringing gifts for the dominican children does not always work out. The maids prefer tips. The food and service are great at the buffet, you have a big variety of foods which changes now and then. We have tried all of the Restaurants, our favorite was Japanese, second the Chinese as we love sushi which they had plenty. Following the sushi you can order a la carte. The worst restaurant was the Caribean. I should also mentioned that they need a lot more experience in cooking the lobster at the Steak and Lobter restaurant. We found that cooking the lobster on the grill was always overcooked and burned. We have been to many different places and Republic Dominican and found that their drinks are very much the same with the rum. Rum this, rum that. One drink we found which was great is their caesars they have discovered clamato juice. Yes! When it comes to tours, watch out they are getting more expensive and less for your money. We took the Aquamarina Tour, swimming with the sharks and stinray was o.k. but the lunch was dry slices of bread and you had to make your own with slices of ham and cheese. We took one tour we thought was worth the price and that is the helicopter tour. Expensive but cheap if you figure how much it would cost you if you would do it at home. We took the 30 minute tour taking us all along the coast and inland. We could see most of the different tours on the coast and all the many different resorts. It was the most beautiful experience I have ever had. They have nightly entertainment, they need better performance but one of the shows was Michael Jackson, that one was the greatest. They need more games and entertainement for the people to participate. They should give prizes or gifts if they want people to be part. All in all I would return again, hoping they would look after some of the little kinks since it is a new hotel and hope the plants and trees would be bigger. P.S no mosquitoes per say to worry about!!

reviews.text: We took advantage of the spa and both my husband and I had massages done at the beach, highly recommend them while visiting the Majestic ask for Rosita has the most amazing hands.
