reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip to the Majestic Colonial and I can honestly say that it feels like home. I won't bore anyone with the details of the flight, airport, or travel to the hotel because it's always the same.
reviews.title: Majestic Colonial - second time was even better!!

reviews.text: We arrived at the Majestic and promptly were given our drink and cold towel which was really needed as it was very hot. We were greeted by Annemarie and brought to our room which was beautifully decorated with towel art and roses. The room was perfect and the location was great, we had a wonderful view of the pool and were close to all amenities. We did have a leak in our bathroom from the room above ours but it was promptly taken care of and fixed within 20 minutes,all was cleaned and working fine thanks to the maintenance guys.
reviews.title: A dream vacation!

reviews.text: Our rooms were cleaned everyday, towels, facecloths, kleenex, and mini bar were restocked daily and we came "home" to our room with beautiful towel art every night. The maids did an excellent job and are very hard working, I have no complaints.
reviews.title: The best vacation of my life!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This trip was for my husbands birthday and Annemarie and myself had planned a romantic dinner for two on the beach. The night that the dinner was planned we had a huge storm come in, it was beautiful to watch from the beach bar and it was obvious the dinner was to be postponed. This was no big deal because no one can control mother nature. Annemarie and the guest service staff dealt with this issue amazingly. After watching the storm we returned to our room to find the most beautiful surprise. The room was decorated with rose petals, jacuzzi was full, tons of towel art, a huge bouquet of flowers and a letter of apology for the weather and the need to cancel the beach dinner. We were in awe and naturally the dinner was postponed to another night, which was fine. When we did have the dinner it was the most beautiful and romantic dinner I have ever had. The extent at which Annemarie and the Majestic team went to, to make sure every detail was perfect was beyond words. Every detail was perfect, the rose petals, lanterns, music, and dinner was all breathtaking. Daniel our server was terrific, he was very professional, friendly and hard working. Annemarie, guest service staff, and Daniel made this night a night we will never forget. Thank you.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the restaurants serve good food, I love the Rodeo Grill and Le Gourmet was fantastic, the staff in all the resturants aim to please and certainly know how to take care of everyone. They were all fantastic but I will always remember certain faces like our wonderful hostess' Marilin and Liliana, our wonderful waiters Juan, Jose, Miguel and a special thanks to Socrates who always remembered us. My only complaint in the food department is that I noticed that the buffets were repetative and the last time I visited they weren't. I also noticed that the hamburgers at the beach restaurant were undercooked, this is truly my only complaint, everything else was great. Thanks to Mariano who makes a perfect pasta dish. I have to say the bartenders sure know how to take care of everyone thanks to our favourite bartender Mike who makes the best drinks go to the beach bar at night and ask him for a Tiki a boom boom! We certainly have to thank Kalvin (babyface), Jose, Vikiana, and Carlos who all took wonderful care of us as well.
reviews.title: Could not have asked for anything more!!!

reviews.text: We were just there for the week starting July 6th. The resort itself is beautiful, food is typical for the islands, however the staff do not get the meaning of customer service. The language problem is huge unless of course you spoke Spanish. We had a phone charger stolen from our suitcase , this tells me the cleaners or whoever else had access to our room went into our bags to retrieve it. Yes I know it is only a charger however the point is they went looking for it. They need to learn from the Cubans on how to train their staff.
reviews.title: Big problems

reviews.text: I will not go back to the Dominican again, I paid lots of money for this trip and did not expect this kind of behavior from staff.
reviews.title: Beautiful & fun

likes.disliked: — The same bad music played over and over on loud speakers at the pool

reviews.text: I always give tips to people but not when a tip makes for better service or attention.
reviews.title: The best

reviews.text: This place lives up to its name. It's very large and it's lovely everywhere you look. The beach is beautiful and if you're lucky, Denny the waiter/"beach concierge" will take your drink order while you sit shaded under a small hut facing the clear, blue ocean. He's very charming as is all the staff at the Majestic. Make sure you bring plenty of small bills because getting change for tips while you are there isn't very easy. There is a lot of food to choose from and even the pickiest of eaters will be able to find something they like. The breakfast buffet was my favorite. This is the perfect place to go to for a few days of rest and relaxation away from it all.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was amazing. They had things to do for all age groups and the service was excellent.
reviews.title: Mixed Bag at Majestic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed our second stay at this resort Jan 11 - 20, 2009. We stayed 16 nights at this resort in Jan 2008 also.
reviews.title: Good Value for the money

likes.liked: — Resort size and layout and our accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used IBK Servicios for our transfer from Punta Cana Airport. The driver did not speak any english and he drove very fast but we arrived in one piece.
reviews.title: not up to expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, Francisco gave us a room in Bldg 3 on the third floor which is what we had requested, however, we had asked for a room closer to the lobby as last year we were in room 3340 and found the Activity area by the pool very loud between 4 and 6 pm when we like to enjoy our balcony and the setting sun. He gave us room 3342 and I asked if he had anything closer to the lobby. It took about 15 minutes, but he was able to move us into room 3319, which was a better match for us.
reviews.title: A Great Honeymoon Trip!

likes.liked: — Great Service, Pristine Resort, Huge Pool and Beautiful Beach

reviews.text: We loved our room. Yes, the decor is a bit tired and could use some sprucing up. The linens are not of the best quality and the pillows are very bad. But the size and layout of the room is excellent. The balcony is also of a good size and has very comfortable furnishings. Our room had a leather sofa and a large coffee table. We love the bathroom area with double sinks and shelf under mirror for storage. Also, we make good use of the large amount of drawers in the room allowing us to unpack everything we brought. Our safe worked fine.
reviews.title: really enjoyed majestic

likes.liked: — the beach, the hotel/rooms were clean
likes.disliked: — sometimes the service at the bar, the photographers

reviews.text: We did not have any welcoming fruit even though we were repeat guests and this had been promised to us. The air conditioning was adequate for us, although we do not use it much. We were given a bottle of champagne but did not open it.
reviews.title: Awesome Animation Staff

likes.liked: — Great staff. Great food and drinks. Nice rooms
likes.disliked: — Sometimes took to long to have room made up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bethesda, MD. We stayed at the Majestic Colonial from November 14 through November 18th and had a wonderful time. We read many reviews on Tripadvisor rating it a 5 and have concluded we were getting very good guidance on this resort! This was our first all-inclusive vacation, so we weren't sure what to expect. We went here to relax, get a tan, drink and eat well, all of which we did to our satisfaction. Staff was friendly, our room was upscale and comfortable, beach was beautiful, food was abundant and always available, mixed drinks were decent brands and readily available, and the grounds and pool were beautiful. They provided beach towels, there were plenty of beach chairs and the beach was clean. People would bring you drinks on the beach or you could just go up to the bar that was right there. Included in the price was use of snorkel gear, wake boards, windsurfing and sailboats. To be balanced, the food was fine with plenty of variety from steak to lobster to everything in between, but I wouldn't call it 5-star - and didn't expect it to be because IT'S AN ALL INCLUSIVE! We read that the South side of the property overlooking the construction site got noisy during the day (confirmed) and therefore we paid extra to stay in a ground floor unit with an ocean view. We left daily $2 tips for the cleaning staff and similar tips for the food and bar servers, which they seemed to appreciate. Other than the tips (which aren't required) we didn't need to spend any money and had a great time. We returned home feeling relaxed and that we got a great value for the price. We would go back again and would definitely recommend the Majestic to others.
reviews.title: Extremely enjoyable, great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the most beautiful place my wife and I ever stayed at. The architecture is exquisite and the grounds are absolutely wonderful with Palm trees everywhere and flowers at every turn.
reviews.title: Paradise Found

likes.liked: — Overall appearnce of the resort and accessibility to the pool and ocean.
likes.disliked: — Lack of privacy when using the toilet in the room.

reviews.text: We enjoyed the beach (which was cleaned early every day of our stay). There were more then enough chairs for all guests and plenty of room to walk around the chairs. There was no issue of towels going missing as my wife and I went into the ocean multiple times and the towels were left alone.We felt perfectly safe at the resort.
reviews.title: Svetlana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a pleasant constant breeze that was needed in the heat of the tropics. When rains or the wind would pick up they dropped sheets like sails over openings that looked magnificent and made a difference and added to the overall look of the resort.
reviews.title: Majestic Colonial Punta Cana....A Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful Country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was absolutely beautiful. We had the standard junior suite which included a 4 poster bed and jacuzzi tub with jets. Very romantic especially with the complimentary bottle of champagne. We had a great variety of food among the many restaurants of the resort. There was the French restaurant with a fantastic Pumpkin-Coconut soup. The Carribean Restaurant had a traditional Goat stew that was delicious.
reviews.title: They forget to tell you a few things......
Wonderful Time at the Colonial
reviews.text: My husband and I, along with my sister and her husband were originally booked into the Majestic Elegance from Nov. 14th to the 21st. A couple of days before hand, we were advised by the travel company that the hotel would not be open and that we had been booked into the Colonial. A bit of disappointment, but we had seen the reviews of the Colonial so we were not worried.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, we never should have been worried - the hotel was absolutely wonderful from the minute we arrived to the end of our stay.
reviews.title: could use some changes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were taken to our rooms, which overlooked the Elegance. Not so bad if the hotel was finished, but the first morning my husband and I stepped onto the balcony and were welcomed by waves from the construction workers. Very polite, but kind of a shock. That day, my husband and brother-in-law secretively went to the front desk and arranged a room change to a pool view and it did make all the difference. It was wonderful to sit on the balcony before we headed to dinner and enjoy the view and the music from the bar area.
reviews.title: Not A 5 Star!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were exceptionally clean, the staff very friendly and all attention to detail was noticed by our group.
reviews.title: Loved the Majestic.......

reviews.text: We tried all but one restaurant and were very impressed by them all. The Japanese restaurant was our last night and it was a lot of fun. The French restaurant was very good as well and the seafood and steak restaurants were enjoyed.
reviews.title: Awesome holiday!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back and loved the week in punta cana at the Majestic.....I was a bit worried before going due to some of the concerning reviews, but we had a great stay...no issues. We did NOT have ANY STOMACH illness, never saw roaches or had any bug bites...
reviews.title: Quite pleased with the Majestic.......

likes.liked: — Clean, Happy Easy To Meet Other Couples And To Enjoy Being Waited On!
likes.disliked: — The told me we would receive chocolate in our fridge...I never got it after asking 3 times!

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and quite fun to be honest! The casino was a bit small but it was never too "crowded"!
reviews.title: An Escape from Reality!!!
Majestic Colonial, Punta Cana
reviews.text: The Michael Jackson show was awesome ....for an island gig!!!

The Disco was alot of fun....the staff went out of their way daily to say "hola" and to ask how we were and if we needed anything! We were impressed at how friendly they were...but then again we do live in boston!!
reviews.title: wow once again

reviews.text: We went on a half day trip to see some other areas of the island ...a familys home , a coffee farm and even to see a school where we visited with some children. We even lost our camera during the off hotel day and the place we booked the trip through found it and brought it back to us the next day...that was impressive!
reviews.title: Nice resort, so-so service, great beach.

likes.liked: — The beach, the pool and the crepes
likes.disliked: — the service, the distance from the airport

reviews.title: Second year for the Majestic
reviews.text: This was our second trip to the Majestic and our fifth trip to the Dominican Republic. We stayed from Sept 21 thru 28. There were four in our party. We checked in and one of our rooms wasn't ready, the manager upgraded both of our rooms to ocean front rooms. My room was 2253. We were very surpised, we thought we just got another room. We couldn't believe the views and the convienence to the beach and pool. It was great. We all loved it. The rooms were very clean and always well stocked. The food was excellent. If you go to the Majestic you have to eat the grilled lobster. The weekly beach party was also very good, all kinds of food and entertainment. My husband and his brother did some scuba diving and we did some snorkeling. The beach was always clean. We also did some shopping at the Bavaro Plaza. Four of us took a taxi at night and it was $20 each way. There was a Hard Rock Cafe and Tony Roma's and some clothing shops. I couldn't complain about anything, the trip was great. I think that this is the best place in Punta Cana. Take a look at our pictures.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel pictures speak for themselves. It is a beautiful resort, no doubt about that!!! I'll break it down for you:
reviews.title: Best Hotel/Entertainment Vacation Ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach: Clean, golden sand, nice warm and turquoise waters. You can take kayaks for a ride and it's an excellent exercise if you wanna keep in shape during your stay. Lots of lawn chairs and you will never have to look to find an umbrella, there are tons!
reviews.title: Georgeous Resort..BUT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Rooms: The best ones we've ever been to. Not only one jacuzzi but 2! One indoor and one outdoor...It's best to get the rooms on the lower level so you have your own private access to the pool.
reviews.title: All we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: French, Steak house and main buffet a MUST!
reviews.title: Tom/ Atlanta GA - Can't Wait To Return!!

reviews.text: I have traveled all over the Dominican Republic and talking from expereince I can say that Majestic Colonial Punta Cana was one of the best resorts I have ever been to. The hotel it self was beautiful, elegant and easy to get to everything. The 1km pool is the only one on Domincan and it was perfectly positioned in the middle of the resort giving plenty of room to have a pool side view. The food, spectaculer. The options are endless at the buffets and to be able to have gourmet style lobster or steak everynight at the a la carte made my trip that much better. The set up for Christmas eve was out of this World, I don't think I have seen so much beautiful food in one place at one time. The entertainment staff were super friendly and so energitic both at the pool and the beach that just listening to them get everyone involved you want to join on the fun to. They smile the whole time and it's for real not for show and they sing an dance and become your best friend right from day 1, the only reason I'm writing this review is really beacause of them. The live shows at night were better then most musicals I've seen and it's all included. Overall my family, friends and I all enjoyed every bit of the resort, they left nothing out and I give them 3 thums up instead of 2. I would go back again and I highly recommend it to everyone, even those with kids cause they had a whole set up and activitiies for them all day long. Stop reading and go and experience it for yourselves.
reviews.title: One of the Best Resorts

likes.liked: — Staff, beach, pool, rooms, food, shows

reviews.text: This was our first visit to Punta Cana, and it won't be our last. Our travel group included my boyfriend and myself, his mother and her boyfriend, and we stayed for 7 glorious days at the Majestic Colonial.
reviews.title: Beautiful beach, horrible food

reviews.text: Visually, this resort was a masterpiece. Decorated for the holiday season and illuminated at night, there was only one sore spot on the whole resort, the construction zone which I will get into later.
reviews.title: Bring towels!

reviews.text: The beach was incredible! White sand and blue water made it easy to stay outdoors for most of the day. You could walk for hours and hours in either direction, and easily get into the ocean at any point without having to worry about coral or weedy swimming conditions. I'm privy to sand flea bites, and usually wear water shoes when on the beach, but I didn't don them once, and received no wounds or itchy situations. Compared to the only other beach I've laid eyes on in Mexico, Punta Cana's was 10x better. We never once had trouble finding chairs in the morning both by the ocean, and by the pool.
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation

reviews.text: The pool was equally fantastic. An average of 3-4 ft. throughout, you could easily laze around, or swim laps without bumping into anyone due to its massive size. Water activities took place in the afternoon, pool volleyball nets were always set up, and the swim up bar was never overly busy.
reviews.title: What a blast!

reviews.text: This is our 3rd time at this resort. The resort is very clean but they do need to update the facilities especially on the swim up junior suites. We had a wonderful time and Erbin Villa, the coffee boy was wonderful. We can't say enough on how well we were treated by Jose Antonio Herrera, Idalia Vilorio and Juan Diaz as well as Camarero. All of the people working there are very pleasant and willing to help any way they can. All the buffet food was good as you could usually find something to eat, howerer, the French restaurant food was awful as well as the Steak House and the sea food is nothing like here in the USA. We found that the Japanese restaurant was the best and ate there twice. We did notice that the nuts that used to be served upstairs at the piano bar are no longer as well as the cookies. We feel that there should be some kind of snack food available at the bars, especially at the pools. We have stayed at other resorts that had this feature. Just a pop corn machine, nuts as well as cookies and ice cream. The entertainment needs to be bumped up a notch at night. We were there the first week in March and the weather was beautiful. We found that some of the servers around the bar area didn't understand a simple "coke Light". Came home to snow, snow and more snow. Looking forward to another trip to Punta Cana next year but we may try another resort if this hasn't been updated.
reviews.title: 4th time to Punta Cans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent just spent a week at the Majestic. We stayed in the Colonial Club and would highly recommend it. Our butler was Juan Reyes and he was great. Anything we needed we just asked Juan and he delivered. We found almost all of the staff to be friendly, smiling and helpful. They all looked like they enjoyed their jobs.
reviews.title: Great staff but disappointing resort overall

reviews.text: My disappointment was in the resort itself. As others have stated it is rather "tired". I think it is more of a 3.5 star resort. We found the king bed to be very comfortable and were fortunate to get goose down pillows from the pillow menu. Our room faced the garden and was very quiet. We actually were able to get Wifi in our room! That was a bonus. My complaint would be about the amount of noise passing by the room door at all hours of the night! Seriously, have they ever thought about putting pneumatic tires on the room service carts or the luggage carts? Every time the wheels went over the tiles (every 12 inches or so) you would hear the clunk of the tires. Drunken patrons coming in at all hours were also very annoying. There was not one night that we were not woken up due to the noise in the hall. We were in Punta Cana 2 years ago and stayed at another resort that was more of a bungalow/villa style. Noise was never a problem there. I would definitely think twice before booking any resort that has room/hotel layouts like the Majestic Colonial.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Majestic Colonial

reviews.text: The food was also very disappointing. The buffets had quantity but not quality. Brown or wholewheat breads were nowhere to be found. The omelettes that were cooked in front of us ended up being raw inside! As previously stated we had stayed at another resort and the food was great. We were expecting the same here but were sorely disappointed. We enjoyed the Steakhouse and the Japanese restaurants.
reviews.title: Mostly awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was beautiful but fairly rough. There are better swimming beaches in Punta Cana than at this resort. Snorkelling was not possible due to the currents and there didn't appear to be much marine life to see in front of the resort. The beach vendors are very few and were not bothersome at all! Many weddings at the beach and they were very enjoyable to watch.
reviews.title: Staff and workers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were overall very happy with everything. Our room was beautiful and clean every day. All the people working there were friendly. The grounds and beach were outstanding--loved the palm trees. We ate at the beach grill 5 of the 7 nights we stayed--loved it and the people were outstanding especially Ysaura, Wrkia, Nicolas---such wonderful people!!!! We will be back for sure some day.
reviews.title: We had an amazing time at his resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a two week vacation at the Majestic Colonial, and do not have enough superlatives to adequately review our feelings! From the moment we arrived at the resort (about 35 minutes from the airport) we were treated well, by friendly staff who did everything to make our stay very comfortable and enjoyable. Our room was beautiful (2211) overlooking the pool and close to the buffet and main restaurants. First off, we noticed the grounds were immaculately kept, then got to our spotlessly clean room and were instantly happy.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The buffet was very good, with a good selection for breakfast and lunch. We chose to eat in the specialty restaurants, but did see the selections at night as we made sure we went for a special coffee at night following our dinner ..... Rafael or 'Tiger Woods' as he would like to be called was there most of the time, made a great coffee with a great show. On his days off he was replaced by Alfredo who also did a great job. We had no problems with any of the restaurants, but particularly enjoyed the Oriental restaurant, both the Tepanyaki and the a la carte sides and the Steak and Seafood Restaurants down by the beach. If you like lobster, this is the place to go!
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.text: Just so you know the quality of care practiced by this resort, we need to tell you of an example we observed. No doubt we have read reviews where there were maintenance problems, but no resolution to the problems when they were reported. One evening on entering the washroom, the door hinge broke so I was left with a door on one hinge that had to be propped up while I phoned the front desk. About two minutes after I reported the problem, the phone rang asking if anyone had been hurt ... no one had! About two minutes later there was a knock on the door and a maintenance man was there and had the door fixed with about another 7 minutes. After he left, within five minutes, another know on the door ... this time the maid to clean up any debris he had left behind with his repair .... there was none! From our perspective a wonderful response ... truly five star!.
reviews.title: Great vacation!
Wilkins made this a great stay
reviews.text: Finally some people we must note for their friendliness and the quality of their service - Marisol whose smiling face greeted us every morning and lunch in the buffet, and Fermin who greeted us with "Coffee, Coffee, Coffee" every morning; Victor at the Pool Bar who ensured we never became dehydrated and always smiling; Daniel and Tony in the Piano and Lobby Bars, and finally Leonard and Rigo at the Steak/Seafood Restaurant who looked after us so well.

We live south of Boston and stayed at the Majestic Colonial over April school vacation 4/19-26/08. This is our fourth consecutive trip to the D.R, and second to Punta Cana. It was very enjoyable for me, my wife and twin 14 year old boys. This was our sixth all-inclusive vacation and one of our favorites. I must admit, with the rash of bad reviews a few months back, we had some anxiety, but it was completely unsubstanciated.
reviews.title: family vacation enjoyed by all of us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we had no problems with our luggage or ground transportation. Check-in was fast and easy and both rooms were ready. The rooms are very large and clean. We had a king size bed and the boys had two full beds. Beds were firm but very comfortable. Pillows were thin but additional ones readily available. We were 3 rooms apart, on the third floor rooms 2310 and 2313 overlooking the pool. Very nicely located, across from the towel building and a bar, close to both the main buffet as well as the beach. There was a bottle of champagne in our room the first night, sushi and white wine delivered the second night, and a small bottle of rum and scotch left two other days. Very nice touches that were appreciated and enjoyed. The rooms were usually cleaned by early or mid- afternoon and towels often brought separately. We did not find the bathroom layout to be an issue, but if traveling with children and staying in one room, some may elect to change in the shower which is very spacious. Expect occaisional loss of power(very common in the D.R.) If it happens during the night, the a.c needs to be reset before it will come back on, otherwise it is just a matter of resetting the clock radio.
reviews.title: The Majestic is Magnificent!

reviews.text: Breakfast: main buffet 7-10:00am. excellent selection and quality! fresh eggs, omlets and crepes along with endless bottles of champagne. The beach restaurant also has breakfast available, but pre-made, nothing prepared fresh. There is even a coffee and juice bar set up in the morning for those that prefer their coffee first or do not want to use the in room coffee pot.
reviews.title: Unbelievable! Exceeded all expectations!!!

likes.liked: — The spendor of the buildings - continues to wow you as you walk around.
likes.disliked: — The noise from the Animation team on the beach.

reviews.text: Lunch : main buffet 12:30-3:00pm again very good selection. always cooking fresh pasta, steak, chicken, pork and fish. Plenty of variety and good quality. Beach buffet good but fewer options. Burgers, fried chicken, french fries and pasta. There was a beach BBQ on Sunday and giant paella on Thursday.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Deal

reviews.text: Dinner: main buffet 6:30-10:pm. Lots to choose from with something for everyone. We always found the quality and quantity very good.
reviews.title: Missing the taki taki dance!

likes.disliked: — too many drunk teenagers (it was Spring Break)

reviews.title: Beautiful location for a wedding
reviews.text: We went to the Majestic Colonial for a wedding in March. Actually, we were hired to photograph the wedding. Hotel is beautiful and has great rooms with wonderful amenities. Particularly like the jacuzzi in the middle of the bathroom! And, food and service at the wedding were excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To view some of our photos from the wedding, click on the following posting on our Blog:
reviews.title: Bad and Ugly, with very little good!

likes.disliked: — Everything else that I had to experience

reviews.text: http://funicostudios.com/funicoblog/?p=162
reviews.title: Going through Majestic Colonial withdrawal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i booked our trip to the Majestic in Oct. of 07' Upon arrival at the hotel we were advised as well as many other guests that the hotel was "Over-booked" by as many as 60 rooms and for 2 nights we would have to stay somewhere else. We attempted to get them to place us at the RUI as we had friends staying there, however they insisted that they did not have an "agreement" with them and we would have to stay at the Gran Bahia.
reviews.title: Great, Relaxing Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note to yourselves, Stay at the Gran Bahia Principe "Ambar" section if you truely want the 5 star experience. We were offered some lame excursions, free internet, free room service, and VIP treatment at Majestic, we were also more than welcome to go back and forth from the resort as we please. How pointless to have to commute to your resort, and free internet????
reviews.title: Everything but the FOOD!!
Falling Stars
reviews.text: We selected this hotel based on the star rating and the alleged top shelf liquor. We were so dissapointed. The rooms were well sized however they smelled musty. The only place you could get beach towels was soo far away from the beach you needed to think twice before taking that long walk. If you pay for "Top Shelf Lliqour ", good luck in finding it. The only locations that you can have a "top shelf" cocktail is at the bar close to the lobby, (but no one tells you this). So, if you are dining at the Restaurants by the beach, you would need to walk a long, long way to obtain your drink. We made arrangements for a nice bottle to be made available to us for a special occasion,at the Restaurant by the beach, what a fiasco that turned out to be. The bottle never arrived and no one could figure out why the bottle was not there and worst of all, none of the restaurant staff had the authority to go and pick one up . All of the hotel staff tries to cover for all of their mistakes. No one actually admits to any of their faults. This hotel should be rated three stars at most.

This was our second trip to Majestic and we found it to be even better than last year. We were received with cold wet towels to refresh from the warm weather, followed by a cold fruit smoothie type of drink. Checking in went very fast, as a matter of fact we got to the hotel at 1:00 p.m., the check in time should be 3:00 p.m. and we were given a room at that time with no problem. The staff at the front desk is very professional and friendly. Special thank to Rosmery, Leo and Francisco for making check in so smooth.
reviews.title: Tha staff is what makes this Hotel a 5 star.
"Amazing Experience"
reviews.text: Our room was a pool view junior suite; we never had a problem with the room not being clean, missing towels or the mini fridge not being stack with beverages or chocolate bars. Special thanks to our maid (Luz) for making sure I had chocolate bars re stack every day.

The rooms are different, the laid out is unique I could say, if you are not comfortable with an open area room, this hotel might not be for you. We are a family of three and we had no problem with the lay out of the room, the bath tub is right in the room, we never used it, we only used the shower. What we did was when it was time for my husband to get dress my 9 year old daughter and I would sit in the balcony enjoy a drink or a chocolate bar while we looked over the beautiful pool.
reviews.title: A pleasant experience

reviews.text: The pool is beautiful it is so big that it never feels crowded, we always stayed by the wet bar since that’s the area where they have the activities during the day. There is always music playing by that area. The activities are so much fun, if you really want to have a good time you should participate in at least some of the activities. If you prefer to just relax and not be bother there is plenty of area by the pool where you can do that. Remember the pool is as long as the hotel is. Special thanks to the bar tenders at the wet bar, Tiburon, Ismael and the rest of the crew. They are great hard working people.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.text: My husband & I, our 2 teenage boys, and my parents just returned from the DR and we can't wait to go back. The resort is absolutely beautiful, and the beach is everything you could want in a caribbean vacation. Denny and Marileni, the beach concierges, were outstanding, and Jesus was a great waiter every morning at the restaurant on the beach - bringing me my hot tea automatically just upon seeing me! Food was pretty good, ate at the Supreme buffet several times because of the huge selection. Only slight complaint may have been the hard time we had getting enough towels and washcloths, but that was a relatively minor problem. We were there for 7 days and never left the resort, and still weren't ready to leave! Don't really see how anyone would be disappointed we a vacation to this resort!
reviews.title: can't wait to go back

reviews.text: Animation Team was excellent. I loved every single one of them. They work from 10 in the morning to 1 or 2 in the evening. They take care of you all the time. There is Walter ... probably the most funny guy... Nina... Teresa...Blaky...Jesus...Sandy... and others... they make you laugh all the time... so if you have nothing to do go on the beach or pool and spend every possible second with them...

reviews.title: An experience to remember!
reviews.text: We have recently returned from a one week stay at the Majestic Colonial Punta Cana resort. I have never had so much fun in my entire life. Not only was the food awesome and the service as well, but the animation group was especially out of this world. I have been to Punta Cana three times, and many other places around the world, and i have never seen such amazing animation. They truly surpassed my expectations. I was alone, with my parents on vacation, i am 17 years of age, and i thought that it would not be that interesting. However, because of the animation at this place, i had the time of my life. The animators are always willing to entertain you and make your stay extremely enjoyable. They interact with people of all ages; from children to the elderly! A special thanks to Francisco, who is honestly out of this world AWESOME, and always makes the shows and every day fun! Also, Sandy is extremely fun! He is so funny and always talks on the microphone to entertain, and it works for everyone, no matter how old you are! Jesus is another FANTASTIC animator! He makes the dancing lessons so much funn! He is absolutely hilarious! What a blast to be around! Last but not least, TYSON! WOW.... those aerobic sessions! He makes it so intense but so fun at the same time! Absolutely incredible! These previous names are only a few of the awesome animators! THANK YOU TO ALL THE ANIMATION TEAM! YOU GUYS ALL ROCK! Each and every one of them! On the last day, when i was about to leave, i began to burst into tears because i did not want to leave! I would have stayed there FOREVER! If you have the chance to go to this hotel...DO IT! Because i can guarantee they will make your stay the best ever! I LOVED IT! NO OTHER RESORT EVEN COMES CLOSE! TO rate this hotel on 10....I GIVE IT 100000000000000000000000000000000000/10
THAT'S HOW AMAZING IT IS! P.s- The shows are incredible and so is the dancing! WOW! CAN THEY MOVE!
reviews.title: Tia and Sobrina-Best trip ever

likes.liked: — Lots to do, activities, theatre, restaurants, entertainment staff

reviews.title: majestic is excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My 16 year old niece and I traveled with a large group (180) from Boston, MA. We were there from 3/11-3/18 and had an awesome trip. I had to take a vacation when I got home to catch up on sleep. (She had me out all hours and I only slept less than 5 hrs per nt for the entire 8 days there.) She has never been on a vacation out of the country so this was new to her. The hotel and staff were excellent and as others have stated if you had trouble speaking english to some, it was easy enough to find another staff who spoke great enlgish. Although there were minor issues (quality of resort) overall it is magnificent and very beautiful, the grounds are kept immaculate and the people are very friendly and most were reasonably easy to talk with. The Animation Team were fantastic both the guys and girls alike. As we were two females without any male companions, not too mention my niece is beautiful and certainly does not look or act her age, we just had an awesome time participating in the many scheduled activities these guys put on all around the resort. Pool games, spanish lessons, stretching and aerobics, dance lessons,archery-if you would call it that ha, and all the silly themed games they do, sometimes more fun to watch and embarrassing to participate in...... FUN FUN FUN. We had fun learning the Taqui taqui dance, and Chocalate taught me the "doggy, doggy" which I can never do now that I am back in the states for fear of being arrested for lude and lascivious behavior I am sure - ha ha. Devyn and Mariel became fast friends even though she speaks little Enlgish. But they all were great Jesus, Andre, Orkelia, Nelson, Pablo, Tyson, Sandy and Samuel. We fell in Love with Rey-he was the most fun - always getting everyone to participate and join in and he is so sweet and speaks excellent english, not too mention he is always running around and working very hard.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Food: Fanatastic, especially the Steakhouse (Chateaubrian and Sirloin were both excellent (the Ceasar salad bar was to die for) and Chinese, The Japanese was fun-however it is not like japanese in the states so if that is what you want then you might consider waiting til you get back home. Otherwise go with an open mind that you are in the DR and you will probably really enjoy that too. We loved the main buffet, better than the beach side but that was good too, just a bit less to choose from but there is always something for everyone. The Seafood was different we were not crazy for the Lobster although others with us in our own party loved it!!!! It really doesn't matter, cause there is so much food if you don't like one thing you will definitely find something else to eat wherever you are. Not to mention they will bring additional meals to you if requested.
reviews.title: The best place so far!

reviews.text: All the good things written in other reviews are true, the resort is a wonderful place to be if you do not mind small things, like problems with room service - there was never 3 hand towels( we had 3 people in the room), or no bottled water in the minibar, or your toothbrash trown away, or the table not cleaned up. To give management a credit - you call room service and they'll bring you requested stuff right away - but after calling few times for different reasons it gets annoying... The minibar is not stuffed for deluxe resort - no nuts, chocolates, they only make sure you have 2 beers in there daily. Oh, no one mentioned it - the resort do not provide body lotion, only shampoo, conditioner and shower gel, so make sure you bring your own, which is inconvenient with current flight rules if you do not check in your luggage. If anyone wants to know - there is plenty of taxis to take you to-from the hotel and airport, cost $35 and it's 30-35 minutes ride. Food is OK, but talking to people from other resorts - it's not something outstanding anywhere around. However, if you have a kid that craves for Wendy's type food - it's only available at the airport and is twice expensive compare to the US. At the end - resort grounds are beautiful and well maintained, but the best place is the beach, compare with the surrounding resorts it is less crowded and calm.
reviews.title: Nice place to be

reviews.text: We stayed for two weeks in a standard room from March 25 - April 8, 2007. As per the other reviews, the Majestic is a great hotel. I've stayed at eight other all inclusives in the Caribbean and this was by far my favourite to date.

The animation team (Francisco) was really good, they did activities all day by the pool, they have games, dancing lessons... so you can either watch or participate. I don't usually go back to the same resort twice, but for this one I would make an acception.

Loved This Majestic Colonial
reviews.text: It was my husband and my first time to the Dominican Republic and would definitey go back and stay at the Majestic Colonial. It was absolutely beautiful. When we arrived I asked Roberto at the reception desk if we had a pool view room and after looking at where our room was located we realized it wasn't. I asked him if we could get a pool view room and boy did he take care of us!! We almost died when we got to our room. He had upgraded us to a Suite with free room service at no extra charge. The beach was beautiful and so was the pool. The food was good, we ate at a different restaurant every night. Service was excellent and the shows were fun!! Beware of the Mamajuana :-)

Definitely great place to stay! Can't wait to go back!! FYI-met a lot of people on the ATV excursion from other resorts that were not happy with where they were staying. They weren't able to swim at there beaches becasuse it was too rough and they said they had the same food everynight. One resort actually closed down everynight at 10:00pm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at the Majestic and thoroughly enjoyed the staff and surroundings. We did have poor initial impression when we arrived thinking we were going to our ocean view room, only to have a direct view of the neighboring construction zone. We called the front desk and were told they were overbooked and wouldn't have an ocean view room available for another couple weeks. I don't mind if the room wasn't available, but the front desk staff could have explained or offered some sort of compensation. Another couple in our group paid for an ocean view room and got it after slipping the front desk staff a five dollar bill. Of the four couples in our group, only one couple got the room they paid for. Based on this experience, I would be hesitant on purchasing an upgraded room if returning to the Majestic.

We are already planning our vacation next year at the majestic colonial. This year we stayed for twelve days,next year we are staying for sixteen days. This was a super vacation made possible by the staff at the majestic colonial. See you next year Me Amigoes!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: We were given an upgraded room because we booked our wedding there. We had 2250, 1st floor at the very end of building 2. Our view was poolside, partial ocean. The patio included a tub (which was only used once). The location of this room is not so private. Because the room was on the end of the building, there was a walkway that many people used to go from the beach/pool to building 2. That would be my only complaint with the patio...not a big deal, but not very secluded and private if you are looking for that. Maybe ask for a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor? The room did have a musty smell, but I think it was due to the ocean being nearby and the humidity. The room was clean, however it could use a little polishing. The mirror was dirty and the ceiling/walls appeared as though they could use a good scrubbing. Still not really a big deal. The minifridge is tiny. There is enough room in it for a few bottled beers, bottled water and sodas and that's about it. The in-room safe came in very handy, as we kept all of our valuables and money in there and didn't worry about a thing while we were out during the day. Housekeeping seemed to come clean the room at a later time in the day (usually around 4pm). If it were up to me, I would have preferred to have the room cleaned earlier. As sometimes we would spend a little time in our room in the middle of the day and needed clean towels. The bathroom issue that many people have with the resort was not an issue for us. We didn't mind it at all. I guess if you are sharing a room with someone you don't know very well this might be a problem. The bathroom area is not completely private. The bed was not great. Not terrible, but not great. It's hard and the sheets felt wet due to the humidity. But if you are tired enough everyday from being in the sun, this doesn't matter that much..you just get used to it.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL

likes.disliked: — most staff spoke very little english hard to communicate

reviews.title: Great place to relax
reviews.text: Food: Probably the lowest on my list of cons. The food is just so-so. Everything is bland and maybe slightly underdone to my liking. And while there is a lot to choose from, after a few days you realize the variety isn't there so much. The breakfast in the main buffet was the best meal, in my opinion. I always made it to breakfast everyday! We tried every restaurant except for the Japanese-Hibatchi table. The Japanese restaurant is open without reservations, where they have a select menu and a sushi buffet bar. But in order to eat at the Hibatchi table you have to make a reservation. There are only 3 of these tables with 10 seats each. They have 3 seatings a night (6:30, 8:00 and 9:30pm). They fill up quick. I would suggest making a reservation the day you get there, as they are usually booked solid during the first 3-4 days of your stay. The other restaurant that requires a reservation is the French restaurant, Le Gourmet. It turned out to be my favorite. The beef tenderloin there was very good. The main buffet serves a decent breakfast, but the rest of the meals served there leave you with much to desire. The mexican restaurant, El Taino was not very good. The seafood restaurant, Tres Carabelas, was OK...the dinner menus at all the restaurants are very select..so there's not a lot to choose from. Again, the food in general was probably the biggest disappointment for me. But it didn't ruin my whole trip by any means!

reviews.title: Beach is awesome
reviews.text: The wedding: We chose the gazebo location with a private reception dinner/dancing at the parrots bar afterwards. The wedding ceremony was wonderful...everything was decorated beautifully, completely handled by the staff. Other than picking out my flowers and music, I didn't have much to do with the planning. Larissa, the wedding coordaintor on site is somewhat difficult to deal with, but in the end she did a good job of putting everything together nicely. The reception was fantastic. If you plan to marry here and are debating on whether to spend the extra money for a private reception, DO IT! It was totally worth it. We had our own music, our own staff-bar tenders and waiters. We chose the BBQ buffet for our dinner. The selection was nice..soups, grilled fish, chicken, lobster, beef, potatoes, salad, broccoli and mushrooms and a variety of desserts. The wedding cake was also nice and pretty good. Our guests really enjoyed everything, as did we. The photography wasn't that great and in my opinion, if you can afford it, I'd hire your own and pay their way down there or work out soem kind of deal. Our photographer barely spoke english and had us in akward poses we ddin't like. With our package price of $550 we received a cd of 50 pictures. If we wanted the other 57 photos that were taken they offered them to us a $8 a photo! I guess for us it was easy to decline because none of the photos were that great that we wanted to pay for the additionals. Oh well, thankfully all of our guests brought cameras and we have plenty of non-professional photos to frame.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon our arrival the luggage was carried out of the taxi by one of the bell hops and taken to a “holding” area. We were then directed to check–in at the lobby (located on the left hand side). We provided our vouchers with the reservation information. While waiting for room assignments and completing a form with your name, address, name(s) of guests sharing your room – if any, and providing an ID, non alcoholic “Majestic” drinks and cookies were brought over to us. While sipping the flavorful Majestic drink, we had a bit of time to fully take in the beauty of the open air Lobby. While it is open, it is not hot at all. The breeze keeps it very comfortable. We were then fitted with our bracelets. My request of having mine a little loose was accommodated. We were also provided with 2 room keys, 2 towel cards and the Majestic Passport (a booklet containing all the necessary info about the resort).

reviews.text: 1. I will start with the language issues first, because in my opinion, this is what really made our vacation as bad as it was.
reviews.title: Majestic Delivers the goods
OK not great
reviews.text: Not only do 95% of the staff speak Spanish ONLY, but 95% of the guests as well. As stated in a review before mine, it is very hard to meat people, drink at the bar with people, and get involved in the pool games and activities when you are truly the only Americans and English speaking out of the group. To give a perfect example, they had bingo at the pool, and the letters and numbers were called in spanish only! now, im not a big fan of bingo, but this is just an example. When the staff does try to translate, which isnt very often because they must not feel the need being that all the guests speek spanish, you cant understand them anyway! My wife and I like to meet people, and spend time socially with other people, and we found it almost impossible. For this reason, we chose not to do any of the excursions! And for this reason, we will not go back to Punta Cana. Last year, we went to Cancun and had the time of our life. I highly recommend Cancun...the RIU CARIBE was awesome...to anyone!

2. The food. I expected a lot more from a 5 star resort. Yes, they had lots of choices, but the taste of the food was not very good! The meats were very rough, seafood not very good. I dont know if I was spoiled ffrom the RIU in cancun last year, but this did not match up. I STILL have an upset stomach!

reviews.text: I have never thought about a vacation so much after it ended so long ago. I have brought everyone of the workers I met down there with me to the US in my heart. reviews.title: Trip was ok, but the staff made it better.
reviews.text: Overall our stay at Majestic Colonial was just ok. The resort was beautiful, but they go cheap on many things like no towels in the bathrooms throughout the resort, pool towels are highly monitored, food was very limited between 10:30 and 12:30, food was similar at many restaurants, you get charged for room service, you only get 2 beers per day in your room, and the unlimited booze doesnt include top shelf. I was disappointed in the food compared to other places I have been. The selection of seafood was very limited. Service was below my level of expectations for most except for a few staff members that made our trip very memorable. For instance, we checked in and they tried to put us in a lower priced room without telling us since ours wasnt ready yet, they never had change for tipping, our room wasnt cleaned one day, the phone in our room wouldnt dial out without numbers sticking and we got charged for making extra calls because of it, the beds were very hard, and they didnt always change our sheets. You mostly have to go get your own drinks when by the pool or ocean, and you have to wait quite a while for drinks when the bars are busy. I believe many of these issues are common with the other area resorts as well after talking with other tourists. Also, the nightly performances were pretty bad when they involved dancing. You could tell the dancers were not very experienced. Michael Jackson was ok and the Circus night was good.

reviews.title: Beautiful Resort But!!
reviews.text: Once you leave the resort, the area is pretty sketchy. I guess it is comparable to Jamaica, but maybe a little worse.

reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Punta Cana
reviews.text: Not everything was negative though. The entertainment team by the pool was great, especially the men. Felix at the beach bar was awesome!!! Nelson overexceeded our expectations and even gave us dancing lessons, and he is sooo cute!!! If Felix, Nelson, and the entertainment team would not have been there, our experience would not have been the same. Pablo at the lower lobby bar was good as well.

reviews.title: Loved the Food and Hospitality
reviews.text: We stayed at the Majestic Colonial the week of December 10, 2007 with a party of 3 adults and one child. The resort is beautiful and the gardens are extremely well maintained. I've never seen so many staff working at a resort. The pool is fantastic and stretches the whole length of the resort. We had storm that passed south of island through midweek which caused major power outages, however, the main lobby and restaurants still functioned. We didn't try the Japanese but the food in all all the other a la carte restaurants as well as the buffet was excellent. I tipped occasionally at the bars, but there is no real reason to. I actually had a $5 tip given back to me at the main lobby bar, the reason being "it was unnecessary".

reviews.title: Mixed review of Majestic

reviews.text: I recently attended a destination wedding for a week at Majestic Colonial Punta Cana and I have never experienced worse customer service. Our package was all-inclusive, and it seems that the employees have the mentality of "we've already got your money, so why do more." When we ordered drinks, we would regularly see our waiter chatting with other employees, sitting at empty tables, and basically doing anything but filling our order. The food is mostly buffet style and is covered with flies. Whenever I found something that I could eat out of the revolting buffets, it was always greasy, heavy, and had been sitting out for hours. The disgusting customer service is generally practiced by all the employees, from the bartender who would harass the women in the wedding party with lewd sexual comments whenever we were at the bar, to the management, who have perfected the tone of complete indifference to everything one says to them. This is by far the worst vacation experience you could have, so do yourself a favor and go to a hotel that appreciates your business. I will never go back.
reviews.title: Worst Customer Service I've Ever Experienced

reviews.text: Our decision to stay in the Dominican Republic instead of the Riviera Maya was an economic one. We were able to book two rooms in Punta Cana(1 for our 2 children 18,14) for less than the price of a trip to Mexico for one room. While we realized that there is far less history involved in the D.R. than in Mexico we relished the opportunity to share an all-inclusive vacation with our children.
reviews.title: Less Money, Good Experience
Majestic is the word - Not perfect, but pretty close
reviews.text: The Majestic was a grand resort with lots of open air. The use of A/C was limited to rooms and restaurants and other key locations. The gorgeous lobby was naturally conditioned with light breezes but never felt hot. One detriment of the overall trip was language. Spanish is the first and foremost of the languages spoken here. You would do well to be versant in Spanish. There is just enough English spoken by Majestic front desk personell to get what you need.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are two restaurants in the resort that require reservations and you should absolutely book them upon your arrival. Le Gourmet was outstanding, a masterpiece for dinner. As far as the Japanese Steakhouse, we never got to experience it because after a full day of travel and unwinding we got to the concierge desk after 6:00 and were unable to book a reservation until the next morning even though there were 3 people sitting at the desk . Already it was too late for any reservations for our 5 night stay. I would make that a priority withany stay here..

reviews.text: Yes, there are mosquitos. Some of the people we were traveling with did not have any problems but we sure did. After returning to our room each afternoon we would kill a minumum of three. They seem to like the yellow curtains and bed canopy. Two mornings I woke up with bites on my face and neck. The maids leave your room door open while cleaning.
reviews.title: Majestic Horror

reviews.text: Always keep your deadbolt locked while in your room. The staff does not use the motion sensor to detect if your in your room...they will knock and come on in. Luckily, we were dressed the first time this happened. The mini bar guy that came around each morning was the worst for knocking and then opening the door. He was great to remember we wanted extra water after telling him the first day.
reviews.title: Dissapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not plan on sleeping in at this resort. Especially if your in buildings 3 or 4 with low room numbers (i.e. 3204, 4306, 3110) pay attention to the last two digits when they assign you a room. Because of the close proximity that the buildings are to each other in the low number rooms create an echo. You hear the maids taking carts through the hallways all night long and even one morning there was a maid cleaning the railing with her broom which was a constant banging. We were never able to sleep later than 7am any morning. These rooms are also close to the nightly entertainment. So if you plan on turning in before midnight...forget it. Remember building 4 balconys face the new construction.
reviews.title: LOVED THE MAJESTIC!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Bring your own pillow. The hotels were very flat. One was not enough and two pillows stacked was too much. I suggest not to risk it if you have neck issues.
reviews.title: The Majestic is Wonderful

reviews.text: My husband and I joined a group of 50 to attend my cousin's wedding in Punta Cana. We travel quite a lot, usually by private sailboat, and I was a little apprehensive about going to an all-inclusive resort. I was worried that we might be bored. WOW! It was FABULOUS! and there was no chance to be bored. The hotel , with its amazing number of friendly, helpful , entertaining, hard-working staff , is wonderful. The 400 metre long pool is perfect- never crowded, clean and welcoming. The hotel has lots of equipment and activities, and an amazing recreational staff. We could join into exercise and yoga classes , or fun games, or just bask in the sun and shade. The food and drinks were plentiful, prepared to high standards, and delicious.

reviews.text: We just returned from a week stay at the Majestic. It was truly the best vacation we have ever had. Everything at the hotel was first class, from the rooms to the restaurants to the entertainment at night to the entertainment at the pool. The service of the breakfast staff, Marisol, Salvador, Yandra, Jermin and Manin was outstanding. We didn't have a bad meal at any of the restaurants and we tried them all. The "animation team", Edwin, Horace, Mama Juana, Massiel, Ivelisse and Kelvin was thoroughly entertaining. They truly became our "Dominican Family" for the week. We had planned to do some excursions off the resort, but all we ended up doing was walking to the flea market, which is right outside the gate. No one ever wanted to leave. There was always something to do. I have already recommended the Majestic to friends and we are hoping to return.

We had talked to 3 other honeymoon couples from Ontario and they all told us that they had swans made out of towels, rose pedals in a hot bathtub and "special romantic dinners". reviews.text: Check-in went okay. There was a bit of a mix up since we missed our flight and had to catch a later one, but it got cleared up right away. We recieved a free upgrade to a ground level room which consisted of TWO jacuzzi tubs, one indoor, one outdoor, as well as swim-up access to the gorgeous, lagoon-style pool. Needless to say, the room itself was as gorgeous and amazing as it sounds. The bed was huge and SUPER comfortable. I usually have trouble sleeping while on vacation but slept like a baby here.

reviews.text: The food started off kinda blah, but seemed to get better as the week progressed. The Japanese Tapanyaki experience is a must!! My husband hates japanese food but it was the most delicious meal of the week! Everything there tasted perfect and the chef and servers were really friendly. The Gourmet restaurant served really good food too. The Mexican/Dominican restaurant was a bit of a let down. Everything tasted a little "off" so we left right away and finished our dinner at the buffet. Buffet food was pretty standard. Had a pasta station and pizza, along with a salad bar and the other usual buffet foods. There's a snack bar that stays open from 11pm -4am if you get a late night craving, and they serve the BEST burgers and nachos. You even see the guy cutting up the tortillas to make the nachos fresh! Ketchup tasted normal as well, which is odd for Dominican or Cuba. Breakfasts were good too.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were at the Majestic from Feb 7th to 14th for the final stage of our Honeymoon. Reading reviews before we went (something I’ve done on all my trips) we were getting a little concerned but knew a vacation is what you make of it. The Majestic did not disappoint!! From the moment we got there, getting greeted with a cold towel and Majestic drink, till the moment we left it was nothing but class.
reviews.title: We'd Love To Go Back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check In – Went very smooth. I had emailed Richard a couple times before and I believe this really helped because after I asked for him, as he had suggested, he took us to make our restaurant reservations for the week, then on a little tour of the grounds and then to our room. Richard made sure we were 100% satisfied with our room and it’s location before leaving.
reviews.title: Second visit ot the Majestic

reviews.text: The Room - We were in room #3339 (building 3, third floor, room 39). We reserved a Colonial Junior Suite and that is what we got. We had a great view of the pool area (not to close to hear the noise) and a view of the ocean. Room was very nice overall. Lots of space, a comfortable bed and marble everywhere. My only complaint about the room would be that the main door is thin and about 2” off the ground, meaning you hear everything that is going on in the hallway, not good when the maids start cleaning at 8am and you might have had a couple drinks the night before and wanted to sleep in. A few extra dollars on day one kept the mini-fridge stocked with more than the usual 2 beers per day allowance.
reviews.title: Fun in the sun!!!

likes.disliked: — They need more waiters by the pool and beach!

reviews.text: Food – Was what we expected. The Main Buffet was OK, good variety which changed slightly on a daily basis. Best option for breakfast and lunch for sure. The two reservation restaurants (Le Gourmet and Matsuri) are worth getting into. Seafood and Steak places by the ocean were average, my wife tried the lobster and said it was pretty good. In other reviews everyone complains about the food but overall it was fine, I’d like to see them try to feed 1000 people with different tastes and demands.
reviews.title: Enjoyable holiday at Majestic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach – Amazing!!! Best I’ve ever been to or seen. Always were able to get chairs. Swimming was great, a few rocks that could have been removed close to the rope but still a great swimming area. Only 1-2 waiters working the beach which wasn’t a big deal as the beach bar was only a few feet away.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings.

reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation at the Majestic!

likes.liked: — Comfortable room, bed, shower, tub etc.

reviews.title: A piece of Paradise
reviews.text: An intimate gem located in a pristine diamond mine.

This was our first time in the DR, we've been to Jamaica and Mexico numerious times. The facilities were top shelf in every aspect. The hotel itself was beautiful {marble and tile and rosewood everywhere}, the room was huge, large sitting area, 2 sinks, jacuzzi in the room, separate rainforest shower stall {that you can party in}, separate toilet closet was a small {but yeah whatever no biggie}, large balcony, mini bar with pop water and Brahma beer. Over all I would compare all the hotel facilites to the Moon Palace in Mexico as a reference which is fantastic.
reviews.title: WOW!!!
Awesome Vacation
reviews.text: Pool was long, winding and cristal clear all the time. Not a real issue finding chairs, but our early morning rising travel partners looked after getting a spot so you should try and get out early if you have a prefernece on where you camp. That said, never mind the pool, the beach is where you want to relax. I've been to Lido Braco, Sandals Whitehouse, Moon Palace, Barcelo Mayan Beach and only the Bacelo Mayan beach comes close to this beach. We walked along the beach to the area that has no hotels and it is just picture perfect! Huge wide beach, sand bars, waves crashing in {careful of the undertow and breakers knocking you over, no lifeguards here}, what a fantastic place.

reviews.title: GO!!!!!
reviews.text: The food was very good despite all the so so reviews I read. We ate dinners in the a la cartes and lunch breakfast in the buffets.
